Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS location but unless you're a heavy sleeper”
Reviews.Author: muttlee
Reviews.Content: LOVED the location of this property. Metro 2-1/2 blocks from hotel; PNB Parabis bank across the street from the Metro and as you exit the Metro, almost directly in front of Wepley's, GREAT crepe place. Close-by is the Moulin Rouge and fabulous cafe's. However, this hotel is on a busy street and rooms do not have air-conditioning. Our room was small but clean and comfortable; however, it was incredibly stuffy and had a smaller window and whether opened or closed, our room was on the 5th floor, over the docking area. All night long, you'd hear the incessant beeping of multiple trucks backing in and the dock person and driver hollering at each other (although it sounded lovely in the beautiful French language)!! If you can sleep in all kinds of conditions, this is a fine place. Staff VERY friendly and helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for Paris”
Reviews.Author: piebaps
Reviews.Content: Any stay in Paris is likely to put you off parisian hotels. They rooms are typically small and overpriced. With this in mind, why not book a budget hotel? This Ibis is part of the chain and a bit "samey" if you know what I mean, but it represents outstanding value for money. Its handily placed and within five minutes of Metro Blanche which is on the same line as Gare du Nord (admittedly the transfer is through Chapelle and its a bit of a hike). Its right at the corner of Place de Clichy and as the website says, around 200m from the Moulin Rouge. This area of town is a little seedy at nights with peep shows etc but don't let that put you off. think Soho in London and you're not far away. there are no brothels and no prostitutes in windows. Don't bother with the hotel breakfast. the area is teeming with cafes and restaurants. Corcorans Irish Pub is close by of you facy a beer (there are actually several Irish themed bars within easy walking). The rooms are small but as you are paying budget rates, you don't feel ripped off. Staff were helpful, friendly and multi lingual. This was my second stay and I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Maharsh S
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading reviews here on trip advisor. And it turned out perfectly fine. The rooms are small (standard europe) but clean and decent. The location is absolutely perfect as the metro (place de clichy) is a minute by walk. Bus stops are extremely close that take you anywhere you want in Paris too. The adjoining areas and locality is excellent as its filled with bistro's, book shops, shopping zones, a nightclub and even a multiplex (right next to the hotel). Montmartre is 10 minutes on foot and is a great walk. WI-FI is free and can be accessed from anywhere in the hotel. Breakfast is extra rate and is decent. Just felt the staff needs to be a little more friendlier, my wife and I were quite peeved by the receptionist from our first interaction and we never chose to go back to take advice or help again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, convenient for gare du Nord and sightseeing Paris”
Reviews.Author: Anlorel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in March. Travelled from London by Eurostar and found bus 54 right outside Gare du Nord took us to Place de Clichy. only few minutes walk to hotel.Hotel was very clean, very comfortable beds,rooms very pleasant ours on 5th floor had view of Montmartre cemetry but some noise from service road beneath us. At least we heard birds singing in the morning rather than too much traffic noise. Excellent breakfast and staff friendly. Location good for getting buses and metro. You can pick up open tour bus at Blanche 5mins walk away. Also easy to get to Versailles as you only need to go 5 stops on metro from Place de Clichy to reach Invalides to change to RER. If you need somewhere very cheap to eat Flaunch is next door to hotel. Meal for 2 with dessert, wine and beer costs less than 20 euros! Would definitely recommend this Ibis.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant ray in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Radioheadkiduk
Reviews.Content: We came here for a romantic break. The hotel is just round the corner from the Moulin Rouge and very close to the place de Cluche and Blanche metro stations. For example it's about a 5 minute metro ride to Champs d'Elysees. The hotel itself is over 9 floors and be aware that although there are 3 lifts they take an age, so young want to request a lower floor. We opted for the breakfast an are glad we did as for that price we would have got a tiny fraction of what was on offer at the buffet. The rooms aren't exactly spacious, but quite adequate for two guys both above 6ft. The staff were friendly and very helpful. All the staff I spoke to spoke impeccable English. The whole place was clean and modern. All in all, for the budget traveller, it's hard to imagine a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: xronis
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for business in May. Room was quiet taking into account that you are on a very busy street (very close to pigalle). The rooms were clean and comfortable. good choice of breakfast and stuff was friendly. Price was good as well considering that in Paris you always get high prices for small rooms. The room indeed was small but again that's what you get in Paris . Tip : If you are fed up with the pigalle try the street right behind the hotel in walking distance , Rue Abesses . Many nice bars , cool people and nice small bistros.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, grand breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: maidmas
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends and so asked for 3 rooms close together in quiet area and our requests were met. Rooms overlooked the courtyard and were quiet, but sometimes a little too warm! (The size of rooms has been mentioned so much, but they are perfectly adequate for a short stay and were clean and comfortable). Great value breakfasts for 9 euros, plenty of space, lots of choice, lovely bread and always lots of fruit. There was also a bar and restaurant which seemed to be always open, but very quiet. We only used it once for a hot drink after a day out and the service was pleasant and helpful. All the staff were polite, pleasant and efficient and spoke good English. They were helpful with 'phone calls when I had my wallet stolen; be very wary of the Metro, not sure when it went, but it was after a very crowded Metro journey. Fortunately we had used the free Hotel safe for most of our valuables. As others have said, the Hotel is in an ideal location for sightseeing, entertainment, dining and very close to Metro stations. Wouldn't hesitate to use again and recommend it for a good value, well located Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay here”
Reviews.Author: dgosul
Reviews.Content: Just back , stayed here from fri to mon only €199 which was very good, stayed last jan but had a larger room. Overlooking the cemetry, this time the room was small & like a sauna , no air con . I rang reception fri nite as it was 22c on Friday to turn on air con but they couldn't , it was good apart from this.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: baconchild
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were travelling to Paris for the 6 nations match between France and England. We booked our trip trip through England Rugby and this was one of the hotels offered in the package. I can only echo what other reviewers say. The rooms are not huge but they are very clean and well equipped and we never spend a lot of time in the room on holiday anyway. The breakfast was included in the price of our room and it was plentiful and appetising. The staff were incredibly helpful and gave the impression that nothing was too much trouble. The hotel was quiet as we had a room overlooking the cemetry and I found the bed comfortable and slept like a log. It is very well located between Place de Clichy and Blanche metro stations so it is very easy to get around from here. We would definitely stay here if we travelled to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 2012, reception staff very helpful and friendly. Lovely hotel for the money, breakfast was brilliant, typically french but you could eat all you wanted. Within walking distance of Sacre Coeur, next to Montmartre Cemetry, very impressive. Room small but everything you need, clean and modern. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, take a pillow and kettle!”
Reviews.Author: tyrannosaurus
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel- excellent transport links and within walking distance of some excellent little shops and restaurants, Sacre Coeur, Moulin Rouge and, on a clear night, you can see the top of the Eiffel Tower peeping out above the tops of buildings down the road... It's pretty basic, (looks like it was last decorated in 1991 or so!), but very clean (maid came in every day) and pretty decent size for Paris (not gigantic, by any stretch, but for the money it's a palace compared to some of the tripe you'll get in that city). Only real issues were there was no tea/coffee making facilities (would have thought this was a given for a chain hotel) and the pillows were awful- very lumpy- we asked for another pillow each, which did improve the situation somewhat, but still, if you have the room in your bag for your own pillow, I'd heartily recommend it! There's a decent patisserie about 5 mins walk, creperie just a few doors down and plenty of other bars and restaurants around and about. I'd also recommend taking the tube to Abbesses metro station- there's loads of lovely bistros in that area, and Rue De Trois Freres has an ace little restaurant on it called Le Paname- 20Euros for a set menu that included an enormous steak au poivre, fois gras and handmade tarte tatin- YUM. Overall, I'd say that if you're coming to Paris for sightseeing, aim for something like this, cheap, clean, cheerful, and means you have more money to spend on patisserie- trust me, in Paris, you'll need it!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, clean comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ivanhoe123
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this hotel and were completely satisfied. Unfortunately my husband had his wallet stolen at Gare du Nord when we arrived in Paris but the staff were very helpful and let us use the phone to stop all our cards. We were on the end of the corridor, so right by the road which was quite noisy but being by the cemetry meant we could see trees and hear birds singing which was nice. The breakfast was perfectly adequate but the selection of meats, cheese and fruit could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nicholap19
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel. As always here, helpful staff, excellent location, quiet room overlooking the cemetery. Very good value for money especially in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in expensive Paris”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAussieGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Ibis for one night at the beginning of a Europe trip. We flew in from Australia, and arrived at the Ibis quite early (9am), but they greeted us and gave us a room straight away (early check-in). The hotel lobby and general areas were clean and welcoming, and while the rooms are small, they are comfortable and clean. Breakfast was great and very good value. Free wifi throughout the hotel was a bonus too. We passed through Paris again a week later and stayed at the Ibis Sacre Couer down the road.... we were sorely disappointed. It was horrible, all we wanted to do was go back to the Ibis Montmarte but we had pre-booked at a discounted rate so were unable to. The Ibis Montmarte is in a good location, a short walk through Montmarte to the Sacre Couer. I would definetly recommend this hotel, it is great value for expensive Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and cheap business hotel”
Reviews.Author: AshishChaudhari
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ibis in Montmarte PAris was a very good, neat, clean and tidy hotel. Exclusively business focussed with internet, breakfast and right across the rail station with excellent connectivity to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “change of room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We got room nr 609 at our arrival. When we came to the room it was not smelling good. We saw at the toilette that you had big problems on the floor and in the wall. It was not a cleaning problem it was somthing else and I am sure you know what problem you have. But it was no problem for us . The reception was very nice and we could change room at once. And we got a room without smell. Thank you for this time and we will come back in may.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in the Montmartre section of Paris”
Reviews.Author: MarkOlsen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the IBIS Paris Montmartre over the Christmas 2011 holiday. I arrived at Roissy/CDG after an international flight and took the RER train B3 to the Gare du Nord station and then took the subway (Line 2, destination Porte Dauphine) to the Place de Clichy station and simply walked a block to the hotel. The hotel is located in a good area near the Moulin Rouge (200 Euros for dinner and a show) nightclub, the Cimetiere de Montmartre and the Sacre Coeur. The room itself, as mentioned by many others, was very small with a small bed and small bathroom. The hotel was very large (9 floors with 42 rooms per floor), clean but basic. The rooms were very quiet as they had concrete floors and walls so I never heard any between room noise and since I faced the cemetery and there with only a small window there was never any exterior or street noise. The room had a hard bed and hard pillows, a desk with chair, small closet with few hangers, shower with a very deep tub, a combination hair, face and body gel, flat panel television with only the BBC World Report in English and black-out curtains that really kept out the early morning sun. In the lobby there were 2 free Internet PC's to check e-mails and print out boarding passes. An all-you-can eat breakfast was available but wasn't included in my room so I can't comment on the quality. The staff were all very professional and easily answered my tourist-related questions in English. This hotel is what you'd expect from IBIS, that is, very small and clean but basic rooms in a good location for seeing the sights. I really had no complaints other than the hardness of the bed and would return and have recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: YoungFlyer
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to be in Paris for a week with my fiancee recently and stayed at the Ibis. The location of the hotel was great. The rooms (though not huge or 'romantic') were more modern and more than adequate. The room was very clean which was really nice to see. The hotel provide free wifi by the day which is a nice bonus coming from a place where everything extra costs... extra... The hotel is located in a great location a few minutes walk from the Moulin Rouge and the Montmartre area is great for finding some cheap and good quality french meals.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: BoffinChemist
Reviews.Content: Had one of the best holidays over three days in Paris. I usually stay in the Opera district but decided to try Montmartre. Scanning TripAdvisor led me to the Ibis Paris Montmartre which surprisingly had a better rating then the more expensive Novotel next door. The Ibis was a great choice as it was clean, efficient, great alue and I had a view of the lfloodlit Sacre Coeur from my window. The staff were friendly, breakfast was good. My single room was quite small but I didn't spend much awake time in it anyway with Paris beckoning. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to the Gard du Nord, pig alike and Moulin Rouge a few minutes walk away, very interesting real Parisian streets next door in Rue Lepic, short walk to Montmartre area around Sacre Coeur. Try to go there at 6pm when nuns sing in the church. If you are a fan of the quirky movie Amelie, the area around the Ibis is where it was shot, and the 'Amelie' cafe is a great place to have breakfast, drink and people watch. The Cafe des Deux Moulins to give the correct name is almost exactly as it was in the movie and the local characters that visit are even more interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good clean efficient hotel in a good location. Rooms smaller than the Accor budget hotel Etap and although freshly painted over old wall paper and clean, still a little dated. Still at least the hotel is maintaining the rooms to a standard. Good sleep, not noisy. Would visit again but would be looking for a deal due to size of room etc.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good price and location”
Reviews.Author: mikieema
Reviews.Content: It's a clean and modern hotel very close to Place de Clichy metro station. The room is newly refurnished, modern and very clean. The bathroom is small, but the shower is very good and relaxing. Unfortunately only 1 towel per person is provided. We suggests you to put a bath robe in your suitcase! The window presents a strange air conditioning which cannot be switched off… noisy and freezing! :-S The breakfast is good and rich. Good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Just right good value”
Reviews.Author: sanjmann
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is the main reason we booked it plus it was a very good deal. Alot of people say the rooms are tiny but we found our double room was fine, we went for NYE and the metro stop place de clichy is a minutes walk from the hotel which is perfectly placed for travelling in and around paris via metro (we didnt need a taxi even on nye). There are some nice restaurants near the hotel and some decent bars etc by booking this hotel you'll save money which can be put to better use in paris!!

Reviews.Title: “bad to begin”
Reviews.Author: Erian
Reviews.Content: I booked a room because I was impressed by the positive feedbacks, but right now I am already regretting that choice. I had a question regarding the payment way and I sent them already 3 emails, without receiving any answer! On top of that I received the notification that they read my emails... I would not call it "customer service". I will keep you updated with the following details.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel for Christmas in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Cobbler1 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location close to metro and buses into centre and within walking distance of major sights. I have a slight disability and was disappointed that our room although on first floor the lift went as far as the dining room and then there was a short flight of steps up to all the rooms on the first floor. Room was good and the beds excellent - no noisy neighbours to wake us as the occupants next door were in the cemetry! Another niggle but only from my point of view was that I couldn't access the shower as it was inside a very high-sided bath and if one has any joint problem there is no way you can risk getting in or out and nothing to hold onto. The actual bathroom could do with a bit of decorating. The breakfast was very good (extra) and there was plenty of choice with very polite and helpful staff. Recommended for visiting Paris but also beware of the long long walk from EasyJet arrival to the train departure area. Not for the infirm as it is a very long way. Paris does not cater for the disabled at all on their metro stations with most only being accessed up and down long flights of stairs - very few lifts and escalators.

Reviews.Title: “Super small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Biese
Reviews.Content: This was probably the smallest room I have ever been to. It was hard for two people to pass one another inside of the room. Even though it was quiet, as our windows were not facing the street, and the breakfast food was pretty good (or maybe I was preety hungry every morning :]]]). I'd say the location is quite good, as the metro stop is like50 metres away, and if you don't like any restaurant nearby, there's a McDonald's another 50metres away :-) I heard the hotel was cheap (I wasn't the one who paid :]]), so it makes sense why the rooms were so small.

Reviews.Title: “great value fro money in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Gerd B Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills property which delivers exactly what it promises. Clean and tidy, small but clean rooms and comfortable beds, good breakfast selection and friendly staff in a terrific central location in the centre of Montmartre. Walking distance to Moulin Rouge and Sacre Coer, Metro Station almost at the door step. Bonus free WIFi Would have no hesitation to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing price, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: sendaiben
Reviews.Content: We booked an advance rate online (65 euros a night per room) for a double and twin room. The hotel is fairly convenient, about three minutes walk from the Place de Clichy, with good subway connections into the city centre (Champs Elysees, etc.). The hotel is a fairly minimalist business hotel (no kettle in the room) but clean and quiet. We were given free (up to 200mb per day) wifi access and didn't bother with breakfast, as the area have many nice cafes. The staff were friendly and helpful, and this was a great base to explore the city. I wouldn't want to spend too much time in the room, but for a sightseeing trip to Paris it was a great, economical option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tgendorf Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This typical Ibis hotel has everything that you need for a few days in Paris. While it's got everything you need, the rooms are descent size (not huge though). The metro station is only a few steps away and the area around offers some nice bars and restaurants. Moulin Rouge is only a 5 min walk away. Extra wishes, such as champagne waiting on the room on arrival where no problem at all. I would recommend this nice hotel when on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean , no frills, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Muriel B
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 days at this hotel in October 2011. It was close enough to the subway so it was easy access to everything. The room is tiny. It was clean and safe and that was the most important thing I was looking for. I did take the advice of other trip advisor reviews and I requested a room with the view of the cemetary. I paid $150 CAN a night so it wasnt cheap. Anywhere else this would be a complete rip offbut you are paying for the area. I also left it last minute so my choices were limited. The front desk was helpful but didnt answer anymore than what you ask. Found the cafes around to be pricey but they had better atmosphere than the cafeteria style restaurant in the hotel . There is a grocery store just down the road as the vending machines are quite pricy on the floors. No ice machines that i could find. I guess this is to encourage you to buy cold drinks from their machines. Our bathroom had a full bath. You might want to ask if your room has a bath if that matters. Overall I don't think I would stay here again unless I had no choice but it wouldn't be terrible to stay there either.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, but I was astonished by the small size of the room, I stayed in the room with my wife and child and I found out that both of us me and my wife can not walk within the room at the same time, one of us must be sitting on the bed, and the other standing or walking in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but the lifts!!”
Reviews.Author: Legspinner
Reviews.Content: You get exactly what you expect with an Ibis. Good location, clean small rooms and good value. What I did not expect was to have to wait for ages every time you want to use the lifts. Because guests have to wait so long for some space in the lifts, they resort to getting in one going down when they want to go up and vice verse. This only makes things worse. This, and the endless problems with keycards that don't work, apart we actually enjoyed our stay. Basically because the location was reasonably close to where we wanted to go. Plus, of course, the fact that London Irish beat Racing Metro!! Go Irish!

Reviews.Title: “Under our expect”
Reviews.Author: Fer_and_Ju Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Despite the great location, this hotel was a little below the average for an Ibis. We are a couple but we were traveling with a family group with children. We asked for connecting rooms for the kids on reservation, and none were available. Our room was incredibly small, probably the smallest room we stayed at an Ibis. Our bed was against the wall, with no circulation around it. They gave a bigger room to my mom, who was travelling alone. The staff first refused and then complained about changing money as we needed coins to buy water in the machines. Safes were not available in the room (but there is a safe room in the lobby). Parking is difficult. Breakfast room is very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The first time that I stayed in this hotel was about 20 years ago, and I always stay here when I come to Paris. In fact when I worked for a major US company who had a major distribution location in Paris, I stayed here every week for over 4 months during a systems implementation I was working on. The company would have paid for an apartment if I wanted. The reason I keep going back is the quality and friendliness of the staff, and the great location.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: LeilaniMadleina
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a few days while visiting Paris. While I liked the location in Montmartre the hotel itself is nothing special. The rooms are rather small and the furnishing is all standardized.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DM_2010
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a week-long holiday in France, and I stayed at this hotel twice. The first time for 2 days, and then after returning to Paris from Mont-St-Michel, 1 day. As others have pointed out, the reviews here have mixed opinions, so I did not know what to expect. But after staying here twice, I can only say nice things about this hotel. Check-in was nice and friendly, no trouble at all. The room we stayed during our first visit was a bit cramped, but immaculately clean. It has all you need from a hotel while exploring Paris. Wifi is free, but you need login codes from the reception. It is a stone's throw from Place de Clichy metro station, which has enough metro lines running through it to take you to most of the Paris attractions. There are a lot of cafe's and restaurants close to the hotel, so you'll be spoilt for choice when it comes to food. The buffet breakfast at the hotel is not too bad, either. Good coffee, nice croissants, pastries and breads with cold ham & cheeses. There's no hot buffet though, but that's not a big deal. The second time I stayed at this place was a bit of a last minute plan. When we returned from Mont Saint Michel, we were booked at New Hotel Gare du Nord. That was a completely shady, dirty and run-down place, and we decided to come back to Ibis Montmartre. Luckily a room was available, and even more luckily, it was a larger room than the one we stayed in before! I give this place an enthusiastic thumbs up... I loved my vacation in Paris, and part of it was thanks to the convenience of this hotel. Merci Ibis!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice of Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Pais with my 12 year old son, and struggled to chose somewhere to stay, as, along with the positive comments, there are usually as many negatives on TripAdvisor. For this one the comments were mainly positive and justifiably so. All I really wanted, was a warm, clean room, and this was certainly provided. The location is good, easily reached from the airport via the Gare Du Nord and Metro. The central attractions are also easily reached by the Metro. The area is fine - many restaurants are within a 5 minute stroll, as are 2 Starbucks. I definitely recommend this hotel as a clean, warm hotel, with pleasant, multilingual staff ( who also provided an excellent Paris and Metro map), in a decent location and an affordable

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Stevie390
Reviews.Content: This is a standard Ibis hotel where I had a clean, comfortable room with view over the Montmartre Cemetery. It is in a great location, close to the Place de Clichy metro station, with a range of shops and restaurants close by and easy walking distance from the centre of Montmartre. The restaurant at the Ibis was a bit disappointing. There was a good menu, but when I went to eat there one evening, several items were not available. It was also deserted of people, so not very welcoming. At breakfast time, the food was generally good, although it was very busy. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Valentine1963
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a Paris trip having stayed at the Ibis Montmartre. What a fab location literally around the corner from the Moulin Rouge and right next to a couple of metro stations. This made it really easy to get around Paris and do all the usual tourist stuff. If you need a coffee fix a Starbucks is only a 2 minute walk away and we found some great restaurants just off the beaten track that were fantastic value for money. The hotel was very neat and tidy and the rooms, although quite small (we had a twin), were well presented, nothing fancy but clean and cared for. Ideal for a couple of nights, any longer and I think the room size would have started to irritate us. We paid the 8 euros for the continental breakfast in the hotel which was good value for money. Plenty of pastries, fruit, cereal etc constantly topped up. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “IBIS Monte Marte”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very helpful. The location was at my preferred location. The beds were comfortable, room clean and the shower was excellent. I only stayed for one night and did not eat, drink, or have breakfast in the hotel. But all other of my requirements were met in full. I would gladly stay again, and recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A good stay! the room are clean and it's OK! the staff it's not very happyness! the breakfast it's very good! elevators are OK! i have a pleasant stay in Paris! Thank you! near the metro station and Moulin Rouge!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but extremely good location”
Reviews.Author: geminiii
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the very central location of this hotel having booked over the internet and not sure what to expect. For the class of hotel it seemed very expensive: £105 per night for a double room in October but although there were cheaper options elsewhere we prefer to stay in a branded hotel when visiting for the first time as you essentially know what to expect. The hotel itself is big, and spread over 9 floors with a reasonable foyer and breakfast area. The breakfast itself is well worth the £8 (approx) for all you can eat with croissants, fruit, breads, cereal, yoghurt cheese and ham. Although there are other cafes within a couple of minutes' walk this is far more convenient and no more expensive. Our 9th floor room was basic but of a reasonable size and had a very pleasant view across the cemetery at the back towards the Sacre Coeur. Although the temperature in the room was ok when we went, it felt as if it could get very cold in the winter as there was a window vent permanently open. The bathroom was simple but acceptable with only one thin towel each, but clean and functional. The bed was comfortable although lacked a valance which made it appear half-made, and we needed to ask for an extra pillow at Reception which was willingly given. The location was the best point by far - 2 minutes to the Metro (less than 5 with luggage!) and 100 yards from the Moulin Rouge. It's a busy, touristy but slightly seedy area with neon lit sex shops and plenty of beggars, but this is after all a city and there was nothing unexpected in this. Montmartre is a pleasant walk uphill and we enjoyed trekking up there each day to eat and sightsee. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and cafes much nearer (within 100 yards) but we preferred to venture further. I would stay here again if I was on a budget but if I could afford it would go for the sister hotel (think it was Mercure) next door for the same excellent location but better quality of accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friend at ibis montmartre paris for 5 night in october 2011 and it surprised me positively. I had heard that Paris hotels aren't so tidy, but this one was. Our room was cleaned every day even the towels were changed! Personell was very friendly and they spoke really good english. Breakfast was a buffet and worth the money. It included bread, fruits, yoghurt, croissants, coffee etc. Only bad thing was that the coffee wasn't that good. It came for an automate and we had to drink espresso because the other options weren't strong enough :D The free wifi was really helpful when planing next days souvenirs. The area was nice and cosy. And lovely little street of montmartre were just round the corner. Moulin rouge and Sacre coeur for the most. We loved it! The elevators were often crowded, but it didn't bother us that much. We had many good laughs at the elevator. People were really friendly and fun. I would defenately come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “IBIS Paris Montmartre cost effective, high standard”
Reviews.Author: abreakspear Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Eleven of us stayed here for one night of 5 November 2011. I had already popped over to Paris and done a quick reconnaissance of the area, and this was by far the best hotel in its price bracket. It is very similar to a UK Travel Lodge. It is bright and airy, the rooms are modern and clean. The beds and pillows sooo comfy! Telephone in room, fab hairdryer in bathroom, extra sockets for straighters, phone chargers. Free wi-fi. The buffet breakfast was amazing, lots of choice of pastries, fruit, yoghurts, ham and cheese, fruit juices, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, and more, too much to list. The breakfast area was lovely, the staff todying and refilling the buffet all the time. The bar area was lovely. There is a chargng post in reception for phones, ipads, laptops, etc should you have forgotten your charger. The reception staff were really helpful and accommodating. I have stayed in many, many hotels, I rate this hotel 10/10. The hotel is in Blanche, within 5 mins walk in each direction of the hotel there are lots of shops and restaurants, and of coure the metro (just 4 stops from Gare du Nord), it is a really nice place. It is a three mins walk from the hotel to the Moulin Rouge. There is a lovely restaurant opposite called Cafe Luna where we had a great steak dinner. The waitress was amazing she looked after us so well, and the food was divine. The cinema is two mins walk down the road. There is cashpoint next to the cinema. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: my54my Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Me and my 13 year old son stayed her for 4 nights in late October in room 502. Staff are helpful, room was small but clean and adequate. One major downside was the temperature in the room - it was roasting on a night time! Had to have the window open as much as it would allow and you did get road noise resulting in a bad nights sleep. Ear plugs and light pyjamas are recommended! Location wise it is an excellent base for exploring Paris as 2 metro lines run through Place De Clichy. There are 2 Starbucks close by, a supermarket, a little convienince store just over the road too. The metro is an excellent, cheap and easy way to explore Paris. Was a little daunting at first but you soon get your head around it. The hotel is approx. 5 mins easy walk from the Metro, just head up the slight hill and you can't miss the sign. Overall this is a good hotel for a short break but I would not like to stay here in summer as the heat could be unbearable. Oh, and room 502 overlooks the crypts of Montmatre Cemetary! But don't let that put you off. :-)

Reviews.Title: “cost-effective”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Even before getting to Paris, the staff was prompt with answering my queries via email. I was given useful directions with using the Metro to get to the hotel from the Eurolines terminal. Considering that this is Paris, and accommodations may definitely eat up the biggest chunk out of your travel budget, Ibis Montmartre is a cost-effective option. Very near the Place de Clichy Metro station, so getting to other parts of the city is not difficult at all. Of course, the room is not big. But that should be expected given the budget. The bed was comfortable anyway, and the room and bathroom were clean. Wifi was free as well, and was reliable. We stayed at the 9th floor, and it was generally quiet. Perhaps my only criticism would relate to the elevators. One (out of three) was out of service during the entire 3 days of our stay. It was a bit of a hassle in the morning when most people are going up and down for breakfast or on their way out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “A the base of the 'Butte'”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights last week for an autumnal trip to Paris. Reception were helpful and pleasant and we checked in quickly. Rooms small but perfectly adequate for our needs. Bathrrom clean and tidy. Always turn left wehen leaving this hotel and you will have exellent acces to the meandering roads at the base of the Butte of Montmatre. The area aroun the Abbesse metro staion (about 10 minutes walk) is particularly interesting with great delis, bars and clothes shops.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: makis_04
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel in reasonable price. Only two minutes from metro station in a very nice neighborhood.The rooms are very clean with good furniture but a little bit small. However you have all that you need. The breakfast is fantastic and is served for many hours in a very nice breakfast area. The staff is kind and they speak English very well. I have to point out that we got the money of our last night back when our flight changed cause of a strike in airports even though we had already prepay at arrival. In conclusion this hotel is an excellent choice for tourists in expensive Paris..

Reviews.Title: “They do overbooking!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were overbooked in our first night. We were sent to a hotel really far away (La Defense). We had a baby with us, there was no consideration whatsoever. I called the same day, 3 hours prior to arrival to make sure the staff understood we were coming. They probably knew already the hotel was overbooked but they told us to come, that the room was ready waiting for us. What a dissappointment. The lifts in our short stay in La Defense are a joke. Seriously. Any one who used it ONCE will know they are horrible. At La Defense, there were no towels in the room. I was told to wait, the towels would be sent to my room. After 70 minutes of wait, I called reception again and ask about the towels. They told me I should come to the reception and pick them up. At 2AM in the morning. I also experienced really bad English of staff members at nights, specially after midnight. Most of them couldn't understand or communicate in proper English.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: bluegaz71
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel with 2 other couples in mid October. This hotel provides great value in a good location in Montmartre. Near 2 metro stations which give great access to the whole city. This is the area to stay if you want to enjoy a good night out as there are plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. The impressive Sacre Coeur is about a 15 min walk away and the Moulin Rouge is just around the corner. The hotel room was basic but clean and had what you needed to use as a base for exploring this fabulous city and for a few good nights out. felt safe walking around both day and night but as other reviewers have commented, be aware of the gypsies and scammers, just walk past them and don't respond and they will leave you alone. Didn't try the food at the hotel but if you want a good hearty breakfast to set you up for the day, go to corcorans Irish bar just around the corner. We emailed hotel before our visit to ask if all 3 couples could be located on the same floor, preferably overlooking the cemetery as we had been told it was quieter this side. They obliged with three rooms next to each other.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris Short Break”
Reviews.Author: Dutch_Hugh
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend of Nuit Blanche/Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe (Oct 1/2 2011) in the Ibis, which appears to be more or less brand new. Although it is a big and busy place it is efficiently run with 24/7 staffing levels, and the rooms are clean and well accommodated with a decent shower, and surprisingly quiet! Without doubt the best value hotel in this good location adjacent to Montmartre cemetery (close to Place de Clichy metro, market, Montmartre bars and restaurants, Sacre-Coeur etc). Thoroughly recommended, especially considering the multitude of horror hotels in Paris for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “To make it short - great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dotan_haifa
Reviews.Content: We were in early October 2011, a couple with a child. Why is it great? 1) It has a great location (in Place de Clichy) where from Place de Clichy you have 2 metro lines and buses no. 74 and 68 to go to the Louvre museum and the Notre Damm church, respectively. Tip (write it down!): better to see Paris by bus. They have great bus system and a weekly metro-bus card costs only 23$. BTW: if you want to step out of the hotel and be in the center of things, e.g., Latin quarter, drink coffee and watch people as bohemian Parisian - this place is not for you. 2) Great staff. Kind and helpful. I especially remember some french big guy giving us a recipe how to go with our 3 years old child to Euro-Disney. Short, helpful, and accurate. 3) Clear modern rooms. If you like carpets and old French decoration - this place is not for you. If you intend mainly to sleep in the room and not spending much day in the room, the hotel is adequate (in Parisian type hotels). 4) Internet (although a bit annoying the daily new password -dear hotel: please fix this...) 5) Breakfast - cheap but adequate. 6) Most important - the price. It has no competition around paris. More of the neighborhood: 1) Great restaurants around Place de Clichy. Mc, Kentucky, Hippopotamus, and many Japanese restaurants. 2) It has a near by super-market open until relatively late. 3) Near Sacra-Cuore chapel. Dotan

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonAussie11
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris a couple of times and have previously stayed near Opera and Bastille. I searched for ages to find hotel for this recent trip as wanted to do it on tighter budget this time, but still wanted good location and somewhere safe and clean. The location is convenient to either the metro or nice walk through quiet, authentic Parisian area if youre heading down towards the river. Hotel was great value at only £75 per night. Room was small but clean and beds comfortable. Staff on reception very helpful and friendly. Hotel was modern and bright. Not luxury but perfect for what I was after.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for an extended girls' weekend getaway. Good location if you want to dine out and stay out late, streets outside the hotel were always crowded even late at night. Walking distance to Moulin Rouge (2 min), Sacré Coeur and Abesses. Had been looking on the internet to find a newly decorated room for a good price but the hotels in Paris are either quite expensive or with very poor or old decoration. Therefore I was very happy with the rate I have paid (99Euros for 2/ day) for the clean and newly decorated room with free Wi-Fi. OK the rooms are small and very very basic but clean and the ones overlooking the Montmartre Cemetery are very quiet!!??!! The staff at the Front Desk was very helpful and friendly. To note: there is no fridge in the room and you need to use the storage room if you need to use an iron. Ideal if you are not after luxury but need clean/new and good value and will not spend your day in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings in this one...”
Reviews.Author: bgdnenad Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Paris is wonderful, and hotels in Paris are very expensive, so I guess there has to be some compromise when you do not pay 300 euros per night. but for us this was a bit too much... Since I traveled with the female colleague we asked for the twin room and received the two beds one next to other! What is even more problematic is that window does not have a handle but you have to call the receptionist to open and close window for you! There is some ventilation in the room but we felt like in the submarine sometimes. Breakfast is buffet and is excellent, like almost all food in France . Price paid for night w/breakfast 125 euro per room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel at a very good price”
Reviews.Author: paddykennedydd
Reviews.Content: It was a plesant suprise for us after spending 2 hours looking for it. Food was good and at a reasonable price, Staff were very nice and very helpful. If in Paris again will stay there as we were only there for one night..

Reviews.Title: “Ibis MontMartre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have been living in Paris for 1 year during which I've been looking for some hotels for friends & family, Ibis Montmartre is certainly one of the best in terms of quality/cost ratio. The room was clean and the hotel is just in front of the place the chichy metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Money Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hobe
Reviews.Content: Location is good - only 2/3 minutes walk from metro station. Rooms are a little bit old fashion style but very quiet and good size for one person. Elevators are slowly and only 2 was in use . Reception looks sometimes more or less too busy. Weekend prices are really money value.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel for the location!”
Reviews.Author: Queen E
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband booked a weekend break to Paris in late August. We wanted a budget hotel in a good location - and this was ideal! Literally a 2 minute walk from the metro Place de Clichy, which was brilliant. Be prepared for a bit of a train ride if you are coming from Charles de Gaulle as i think that total journey with transfers is about 1.5 hours. We arrived at about 11pm at night, and the area is buzzing! A 2 minute walk to the Moulin Rouge and there are a number of restaurants within walking distance that serve food until late. Be aware that this area does border on a red light district, maybe not the best for little children at night! On arrival, we were given an awful room on the 1st floor, twin beds, though i had booked a double. We did not have the option of moving as the hotel was fully booked that night. The decor was old, reminded me of student halls and the carpet was horrible and sticky! When i looked out the window, I realised we had the view of the Monmartre Cemetry - a bit spooky, so make sure to request a courtyard room on arrival if this would bother you. Fortunately, the next morning on speaking to reception, we were moved to a modern 5th floor room, with wooden floors - much much nicer! Exactly what you see in the pictures on their website. The rooms are compact, but we literally only used ours as a base to sleep. Though there are 3 lifts, they are REALLY slow - we ended up climbing the stairs every day as you could wait for a lift for 10-15 minutes! The Eiffel Tower is about an hours walk, half an hour to the Arc de Triomphe - but they are all relatively close on the metro. Would stay here again, if visiting Paris for a short weekend - dont expect luxury, but it is clean, most of the staff are helpful and it is in a very good location for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: ciao82
Reviews.Content: The hotel experience didn't start off that great because they screwed up my reservations and gave me a single bed room when I clearly reserved a 2 bed room. They had none available the day we checked in and after which point we had already unpacked a bit of our stuff and since I was with my sister we decided to sleep in the same bed. The rooms are small, just enough for a bed a desk and chair. The location is very good considering you are not in the center of Paris, There is a subway (metro) station about a 2 minute walk from the hotel and we bought ourselves a 3 day pass and used the subway often enough so you should consider buying a pass. There are many restaurants and cafes nearby and the area was always very "lively" so even if we came back late at night we felt safe. We walked a lot and the streets could get somewhat confusing even with a map because they like roundabout streets and the same street could have 3 different names depending on the cross street. Suffice it to say you will be using the map the hotel provides you - ours is in pretty bad shape after 5 days of touring. All in all I'd probably go back to the hotel because the location and area is really good.

Reviews.Title: “It's not bad”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. There are many restaurants around making it easy to choose where to eat morning, noon and night. Although, it's a very 'happening' place it's not noisy enough to keep you awake at night. The metro is also very close by so that makes it easy for transportation. The bed was pretty comfortable but keep in mind it is Europe so the room is tiny. I would suggest bringing towels because they don't provide you with many (i.e. only 3). I asked for an extra one and they did give it to me but I'm sure if I asked every night they wouldn't have been so accomodating. Free wi-fi is available but it's not the most reliable...I had issues with receiving messages but it was still a plus to have. The channels on the TV are really lame so don't bet on watching TV lol. Overall it's ok and I would probably stay there if I had to go back since it wasn't too expensive compared to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: zz01
Reviews.Content: Fine location, but old hotel. Reasonable breakfast. Beds ok. Friendly people. WIFI did only work in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice both for tourism and business”
Reviews.Author: picciona
Reviews.Content: Located 5 minutes from the metro station, this is a 3 stars big chain hotel. Clean and quite; room a bit small but very good choice for the location and price. You have to pay extra breakfast but it is very good and has flexible time (from very early morning to 12). No minibar in the room, so the advice is to buy water from some near mini market. The only "problem" (if you can named it so) is that there are only two elevators in the hotel, and if you are located in the top floors (9 in total) in the morning is a nightmare to catch it! Rooms in the back watch onto the Montmartre cemetery, but are very very quite.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Iesje1988
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, very nice, very big room..We always take this hotel when we went to Paris...there are a lot of restaurants and it's close to the metro.. :) The service was excellent!!In the hotel is free WIFI!

Reviews.Title: “Good base and good value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: raiderlove214
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within easy walking distance to Sacre Coeur and Montmartre with Metro stations nearby. The front desk/reception was welcoming and efficient, and the rooms were clean. The only negatives were the rather slow lifts and in our first room, the air conditioning was not working. The buffet breakfast, which seemed to be a little expensive, proved to be excellent value with a very good choice of cold foods. Would recommend as a base for a visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There are no facility for Morning tea in the room. No Kettle, and they do not give any tea in room service. The basin was clogged and was not resolved for two days inspite of their 15 minute guarantee. I was warned at the reception about pocketknives in the surrounding area. The AC did not work properly. The only thing good about the hotel was that it was very close to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: ILoveRio74
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the previous reviews in TripAdvisor we chose this hotel. We managed to get a special discount booking directly on the IBIS website, which made it more affordable than the regular rate. Our room was on the 2nd floor at the very end of the corridor. I went with my partner but deliberately asked for two twin beds so that the room would be bigger and it worked! In the room the storage space was very basic: 6 hangers in on open closet and a few shelves but we managed fine with that. The bathroom was a good size too, with no window but with air vents which provided ventilation. We were offered free wifi but it didn't work in our room, only in the reception, so we used one of the two free pcs in the reception area instead. We never bothered with breakfast, we're not morning people! The best thing about the hotel is it's location. There are two metro stations are walking distance: Place de Clichy and Blanche. There are restaurants, bars, grocery stores, even a cinema showing a movies in English. I would definitely return! :)

Reviews.Title: “OK, but the rooms are very small and bring your own towels, not suitable for families”
Reviews.Author: DarianB
Reviews.Content: It was OK I guess, for the price. Very convenient location. Reasonably clean. But, the rooms are extremely small, especially if you take a twin option (double bed + single bed). The single bed folds out from the wall. In his sleep, my son kept hitting his head and legs on a piece of the bed that was sticking out above him. Also, the standard towels are really nasty things. I recommend to bring your own. Finally, the lack of any facilities that might appeal to kids makes it a poor choice for families (never mind what's going on outside the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LetsHopeTheSunShines
Reviews.Content: A good budget hotel, easy to find and close to Metro in a good location. Easy walking distance of Moulin Rouge and Sacre Coeur. The room was clean and the bed was comfy. The only major downfall was the lack of kettle and tea/coffee in the room, this was a real shame. We just assumed that the room had it although now I look back at the things I can see that it isn't listed. I would use the hotel again - the 5 euros to look after our luggage after check out seemed ok to me and the continental breakfast was good value for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend !!!”
Reviews.Author: GinsTheThing
Reviews.Content: We booked a 'chain' hotel because we did not want to sabotage my daughter's first overseas vacation. ie grotty (of which cheap Paris hotels are nototrious). Am really pleased to report that the hotel did not disappoint. It was in excellent, decorative condition, the rooms were clean, very quiet at night, the staff courteous and helpful and the breakfast an excellent buffet. A tiny, tiny niggle was the traffic jam experienced sometimes at the 3 lifts that served all the floors (9 of them) at peak times (eg breakfast). But that's quite minor and the only thing I can mention negatively. Nearby Metros Blanche and Place de Clichy meant short hops to the sights, an added bonus with the hotel's location within walking distance of Sacre Coeur and wonderful Monmartre. Excellent !

Reviews.Title: “Very good location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sanjaya_Wijeyekoon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days. Small, clean room, onsite cafe and bar, very convenient 10 minute walk to Montmartre. In fact being avid walkers we found that much of central Paris was easily accessible by foot from this hotel. We would certainly go back

Reviews.Title: “It was alright”
Reviews.Author: Madddie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights for my birthday. Reception staff were friendly.The room was tiny and we were on the 9th floor which meant we had an amazing view of Pairs, I thought 'Great!!' ...until it came to trying to get a lift from the 9th floor with only 2 lifts working, we'd have to wait for a good 2 - 5 minutes every time we wanted to go downstairs. The shower had drainage problems and the bath filled up before you had time to finish having a shower. The mattress and pillows were uncomfortable. The breakfast was good and a great value way to fill yourself up. All round it was ok for the money and would possibly stay again, but request to stay on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Location”
Reviews.Author: Yusliza
Reviews.Content: - Good location for travelers (Walking distance to Sacre Couer, Moulin Rouge and Public Metro). - Room are too small for a shopper (which need a bigger space for shopping bags). - Price is acceptable with complimentary internet access at the lobby. - Easy to get Muslim's Halal Food nearby the hotel. - Though we get a room view of cemeteries, we do not face any problem. It is a nice view compared a room with roadside view.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: francescaHerts
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our children in 2 rooms with an adjoining door. The rooms were clean and comfortable with a nice view over the cemetery with Sacre Coeur in the distance. For the price, I would recommend this hotel however it was a bit noisy at night. There was a bit of a fetid drain smell in both of the bathrooms and the free wireless was an exercise in frustration as it never worked. The lifts were a nightmare - average wait was at least 10 minutes. Overall though, it was fine for a short break during which we spent very little times in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: ciaranroddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and four children stayed here for 7 days in July. We had booked 2 rooms. Where as our overall experience was quite good, it did get off to a shaky start. We arrived at the hotel at about 10.30pm quite tired from travelling all day to get there. When we arrived at check in it was immediately obvious that there was a problem. The guy at the desk first said that he thought that our flight was delayed and that he wasn't expecting us until the following day. This was not the case and I asked him where he got that information from but he did not reply. He continued to work at his computer and then disappeared to the back office for a while. He reappeared to tell us that he was going to organise a taxi to take us to another hotel (the name of which I cant recall). I told him that this was not satisfactory and that we wre tired from travelling all day. I questioned him again as to where he got the information on our flights. He then changed his story to one that the rooms were being refurbished and were not handed back on time. He then progressed to tell us that he had a room in the ajoining Mercure hotel where part of our group would have to stay for that night and the other part of our group were allocated a room on the 3rd floor. We were told that in th emorning we would have to bring our baggage to reception in the morning and that we would be allocated our rooms later in the day. We reluctantly accepted this. This meant that we were unable to unpack at that stage. In the morning we double checked with reception to ensure that the arrangements still stood. We were then told that they had had found a free room next to the one we were allocated on the 3rd floor. This was fine but I informed the receptionist that when we booked the hotel months earlier that we had expressed that we wanted a room on the top floor (as a result of reviews read on Trip Advisor) with a view of the cemetary. This was followed up with a telephone confirmation at the time and a further reminder email a week before we travelled. I was informed by the receptionist that there were no family rooms on this floor. I asked why I wasn't informed of this in my 3 previous communications with them but got no response. Despite our shaky start I have to say that we enjoyed our stay at the Ibis. It has been well covered in many previous posts as to how convenint this hotel is to Montmartre, Moulin Rouge, Metro etc and it really is. Being so close to the metro makes all parts of Paris so accessible.On two days we went to Disneyland and it only involved one train change. The rooms even with a double sofa bed in it for the children left enough room to move arround it and sore our empty suitcases. We have stayed at Ibis hotels before and knew what to expect. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The only downside was that the aircon did not chill the room enough and water did not drain away in the sink quick enough. In the mornings the buffet breakfast was excellent. There was the usual continental fare - fruit drinks, coffee, tea, hot chocolate etc. Cold meats, cheese, cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, cakes breads etc. The only critisism I would have that the choice became a bit monotonous after a week. Maybe a slight variation every couple of days would suffice. Although they did provide bar and restaurant facilities we did not use them and it appeared that no one else did either. Again as mentioned in previous posts you have to pay for storing baggage. This is the first time that I have ever come accross this and I believe that this is a service they should provide free of charge. Their storrage is in the form of lockers of which there are few and I dont know what you would do if these were full. Overall we were happy with our stay and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby,but cheap enough by Paris standards”
Reviews.Author: Endecot
Reviews.Content: This Ibis is in a good location but really it's shabby enough. having said that though they were refurbishing the rooms and ours was clean,it's just the common areas like the lobby and corridors had seen better days. Look,this is a budget hotel,we all know that about Ibis so bearing that in mind I wasn't expecting luxury and I didn't get it. Free wi-fi was a bonus though and the staff at reception were very helpful. It's ok.My room was clean and that's the most importnat thing.Paris is expensive and the location and price of this hotel was good in that respect. Breakfast was a buffet type thing,continental breakfast which was quite good actually,although it was extra as far as I remember but good value nontheless.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, staff not so ok”
Reviews.Author: atx_sw Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel I read reviews for Paris and found many hotels were terrible, while this hotel may be better than some the staff, AC, and elevators make for a bad experience. 1. The elevators are slow and the card readers can take multiple attempts to read your card 2. I would call the front desk and ask for something like 2 pillows, they told me to come down and I could get them. When i finally got to the desk I was made to wait for a while, then I was told they only could find one pillow. 3. The AC in the rooms barely worked, granted this is better than not working at all it did not keep the room cool. On multiple occasions the cleaning staff would turn off the AC so that when I came back to the room it was blazing hot and would not cool down for hours. i stayed in many Accor hotels throughout Europe and this was by far the worst, even including Etap hotels which is their lowest end. I would recommend avoiding this hotel in Paris and find one with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great View at a Bargain Price”
Reviews.Author: Bury-Barrow Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location near to Montmartre and the Sacre Couer. Vibrant atmosphere on the streets around the hotel. A bargain at only 65 euros with breakfast. We had a balcony on the 9th floor wiith views over Paris and the Eiffel Tower. Only minor downside was a drain odour from the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel. Will return!”
Reviews.Author: Lee W
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much, as it was a relatively cheap hotel, but we were pleasantly surprised. Rooms are small (as all Paris hotels), but we had two suitcases and still sufficient space to move around. Perfect location.. Two minute walk to place de clichy train station, two minute walk to the moulin rouge, hop on bus tour stops. Perfect for tourists! Breakfast is €7 pp and well worth it... Great selection of cakes, pasties, yoghurts, fruit, bread, cheese, meats, coffee, etc. Staff are very friendly and can speak many languages. They made us feel very welcome, and I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “good location and price”
Reviews.Author: jo m m
Reviews.Content: Very good value - clean and tidy. Room not overly large but you don't spend much time in it as there is so much to see. Very close to two metro stations (Place de Clichy and Blanche). Blanche brings you out right in front of the Moulin Rouge. The metro line is easy to get to the centre - Eiffel Tower etc. Also it is easy to get from the airport (CDG) - take the overground train to Gare du Nord (clearly marked at airport exit) and then walk through station to the Metro station (La Chappell) - the line then goes straight to near to the hotel. Costs from CDG to Gare du Nord is about 9 Euros one way. Then you need to get a metro ticket to go the rest of the way. Buy a book or a 1 or 2 day pass depending on how much you intend to use the metro. The hotel is a 10 minute nice walk up to Sacre Couer. Lots of reasonable (for Paris) restaurants and bars nearby. The breakfast in the hotel is worth booking as it is an all you can eat buffet - lots of fruit, pastries, toast, cereals, ham, cheese etc. I think it was about 8 Euros and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap option for Paris, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: AddiesGrammy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. It is the only time in my amost 50 years that I have had to go ask for toilet paper in a hotel. The rooms are small with little other than a bed. The bed was ok, but he mattress was not a real mattress, but a 2 inch piece of foam. For what it was it was not too bad to sleep on.tThe wall had an attached desk and there was a small closet area to store clothes..but no where to store your luggage to get it out of the way and make room for your stay. There is only one empty outlet plug in the room. There is no where for a lady to plug in a hair dryer or curling iron to do hair. I must say it was clean and a good location. The metro was just down the street and it gave the choice of 2 rail lines for easy access to all of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “My review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location: easy walking distance to the heart of Monmatre. Breakfast was good value. As a tourist from the UK, I am used to tea/coffee-making facilities in hotel rooms but this does not happen in France. You can get a drink at this hotel, from the bar area and they will even put it into a take-away cup. However, I did miss my early morning cup of tea!

Reviews.Title: “Your average budget hotel...”
Reviews.Author: walter6504
Reviews.Content: 6 night stay in July 2011 Positive: 1. Fresh coat of paint on walls and ceiling. 2. Bedside reading lamps have two setting, high and low. Negative: 1. Website said room had an electric kettle, but ours did not and the front desk staff said the rooms do not have electric kettles. 2. Room very small and tired looking. 3. Only one available electric outlet in room. None in bathroom. 4. No hotel security staff. 5. Only one small waste basket located in small bathroom. 6. Soap dispenser in bathroom has liquid soap for you to use on your hands, in the shower, and to shampoo with. No lotion or other toiletries. 7. Cheap quality towels (you get two small bath towels and one hand towel) and pillows. 8. Water temperature in shower is difficult to regulate. Hot, then cold, then hot again. 9. Breakfast is 14 euros. Two blocks down the street is a Quick (avoid McDonalds) with a good breakfast for 5 euros.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Renata_2011_11
Reviews.Content: Nice location, close to subway station and some attractions (moulin rouge, sacre couer) great desk service, quick and they are very helpful. I would also recommend to take the breakfast, we payed 8 euros per day, but it worth it, since if you go to have the same breakfast somewhere else, you'll certainly pay much more. There is free wifi available, which is great. The rooms are small, but its completely fine, since you wont spend much time inside a hotel room in Paris. The cleanliness is not that great, but you get what you pay, so, I would still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: mrsMal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a really nice basic hotel. We only used it to sleep, other than that we were always outside enjoying the summer in Paris. Easily accessible by Metro Place de Clichy or Blanche (we always used Place de Clichy). A lot of cafes & restaurants around in case there's a need to grab anything in the middle of the night. Just bare in mind to keep an eye on your belongings. Moulin Rouge is just around the corner too. There's a hole with strong air blown from underneath where you can take pictures ala Marilyn Monroe. Nice! Staff were quite friendly. Couldnt fault the hotel. Good experience...

Reviews.Title: “top location in the beautiful montmarte area”
Reviews.Author: kurtkobain31
Reviews.Content: great business hotel located in the beautiful Montmarte area.. good proximity to Montmarte night life, subway and awesome food joints.. and even movie theatres... good breakfast, clean rooms and good service.. overall a positive experience..

Reviews.Title: “A fab budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: flesGlasgow Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in July 2011 after booking online just three weeks before. We found the hotel easily, being only two minutes walk from Place de Clichy metro. The location is fine, turn left at the hotel entrance for a short walk to Montmatre - such a beautiful place, so peaceful and full of good little cafes and restaurants. The hotel is near the red light district and the Moulin Rouge, we had no issues with this although I imagine others might feel uncomfortable. Plenty of bars, restaurants and fast food joints in this area. Hop on the metro to reach all the sites - we found that it was no more than 10 minutes on the metro to most of the sites. The hotel itself is a fab budget hotel, the rooms are basic but have everything you need and a not bad size - on a par with Travelodge/Premier Inn. Not the sort of place to go to if you are looking for 5* luxury or want a traditional parisien hotel though. Essential in summer is the air-conditioning in the rooms! No problems with noise, we looked out onto the cemetery and it was very quiet. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel so cannot comment on this although we did go to the bar on our last night and found it to be the cheapest place for drink that we experienced in Paris and the staff were helpful. If you are looking for a cheap but good hotel, this is the one to opt for, would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean and easy to get to. Although some said it felt dodgy at night, I didn't feel this at all. Will stay again here when I come back to Paris. Tip: ask for a cemetary view Tip: take 81 bus from chatalet straight back to clichy and hotel - 10 mins at night - easier than metro

Reviews.Title: “Budget standards for poor value price and pervert staff”
Reviews.Author: Jolly_Viking
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty average budget hotel standard. I have stayed in two Ibis hotels before and those were more up to date. Rooms are tired looking and there is bad sound insulation between them (I'm a deep sleeper but was woken up at 0530 two days running). The special surprise was the knock at the door at 0850 one morning, followed less than half a second later by the house keeper flinging the room door wide open. I was in the all together! It didn't bother me too much as I'm not particularly shy but I know some people who would be very upset indeed. God only knows what she was hoping to walk in on. Fine if you get a good deal and are on a real budget but there are better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TomasMarny79
Reviews.Content: We had nice and clean room directed to cemetery side. The breakfast was very good. Juices, fruits, ham, cheese, ciabatta, baguette, coffee, cake..... Check in and check out without any problems. Staff in the reception and on the breakfast can speak english, so no problems. In the surrounding is metro station for lines 2 and 13.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from really helpful staff. Room OK, probably a bit small - but why spend time in the room in Paris ? Location good - on the edge of Montmartre, a stroll up the winding streets to Sacre Coeur, not far from Moulin Rouge, close to lots of bars and restaurants around Place de Clichy. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but rooms could be better”
Reviews.Author: monymontana Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the Hotel is fairly in a good location just few steps away from place de clichy metro station, short walking distance from sacre coeur and monmartre , then from there u can easily walk to hotel de ville and chatelet and neighboring areas, also just on the corner of the street is the start of the pigalle area u will sea moulin rouge from the corner and it is a very lively area full of bars and clubs and nightlife.the only down side is the rooms but to tell the truth this is the thing with IBIS hotels, the rooms are very basic and small in size, our room view was the cemetery which wasn't very pleasing, and it would have made a big difference if the room had a mini bar fridge where u can store some water and cola, anyways if ur not planning to spend a lot of times in the room and u'll be out most of the time then i recommend this hotel for you, enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Clean, functional and good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Narold
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to the other reviews - this is a clean, functional and well priced hotel. The rooms are small, but I suppose you have to accept that for this price and in this city it's standard. Breakfast was very good, lots of choice and available till midday!! The staff were very helpful and spoke good English. Everything was pretty much as expected and I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was so helpful and kind! Wailf (I know I spelled it wrong) was so helpful and recommended an amazing seafood restaurant (Wepler) close to the hotel. He gave us great directions and always had a smile on his face. My French is poor but his English is more than great! It was very close to the metro and easy to get to and from the hotel. We had a view of the cemetery but you could also see one of the two windmills and Sacre Coure! The room was very clean and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a short break - no fuss hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lankaLondon
Reviews.Content: I had to book this quickly as anther hotel had cancelled our booking at the last minute so I didn't expect much from a hotel chain But I was very supprise good quality hotel and reasonable price and close to all the attractions of pigale and monmarte. there were 16 of us staying there and we all had good rooms and no bad experiances. Even on the last day we were able to store our kit and wander around till 3pm . I heard the breakfast is good but we opted to try the local cafes for the atmosphere. these guys are straight forward and don't make a fuss. The views from the room are either to the court yard or the cemetry , I chose the cemetry as it was very peaceful and senic. There are no frills or great views but the room and the location is value for money and dealing with a chain hotel you get the reliablity and the confirmation of the room. My friends went back there for the honeymoon so they must have liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: pembakurobuta Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is old and small, bathroom is terrible. They only give you one bath towel and that is it – not even a hand towel. And the bath towels are so old and always leave white cotton everywhere on your face and body. There is no facial tissue in the room, nor bottle of water or kettle or cups – just nothing in the room. Air condition doesn’t work properly and made this huge noise a few times at night. I was very sick on the last day they refuse to find the nearest doctor or hospital. She told us just go to pharmacy. Finally after asking for the nearest doctor for the 20th times, she finally looked for it. If you leave luggage at the hotel, they will tell u to put the luggage in their room yourself and you will have to pay for using their locker. In addition be aware of them over charging you, they persuaded us to have breakfast there at check-in when I have told them many times that we do not want breakfast there. And when we checked out, they added breakfast to the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Lila_UK
Reviews.Content: Expected a bit higher standards...and didn't get them. Room was very small, we booked double room, but got two single beds with two single separate duvets - joined together instead - not good. Window small, withouht the handle - looks like someone snapped it - so could not open it. No iron in the room, no tea / coffee facilities either. Bath towel size of the handtowels and very thin.
