The main staircase was out of order from Thursday night - when we arrived until late Sunday afternoon when we left - I have seen noone working on it, but it remained closed - very annoying for someone like us - who had bedroom on 1st floor but had to wait for the lift 10 minutes everytime we wanted to get up or down! I usually take stair but on this occcasion couldn't locate even evacuation stairs which would lead us to the hotel lobby. I ususally stay in at least 3star properties and thought this was at leats 3*** - but it is definetly not. I will not be staying in another IBIS Breakfast was nice thoguth and only 8euros - good value, but nothing cooked so if you like scrambled eggs in the morning - this is not for you. There was plenty to chosse from - pastries, baguetts, crossaints and even ham and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, no frills, but we weren't paying for frills. Clean and near where we wanted to be. The only hotel during our month trip that we booked and paid in advance for. Other hotels/inns were booked but not paid for until we actually stayed there. Not a problem, but if we had to cancel don't know how our getting funds back would have worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: TravelVitamin
Reviews.Content: First time stay in this hotel. I booked via internet a few months beforehand and got a very good deal. The room although is small but you're in Paris and you stay not too long in the room so that's not a fuss. LCD TV in room. Bathroom is good except the cleaning is not that sufficient. Saw hair here and there and even on the wall. One thing we don't like was the housekeeping knocked on your door at 8am and then we put the "Do Not Disturb" sign out, we still got disturbed by the housekeeping at 9am. The breakfast is good and the area is clean. Hotel close to metro station so it's very convenient. Overall good value.

Reviews.Title: “everything but a smile”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel had everything we required - great location with handy parking for central Paris, clean and tidy room and public areas, good and well organised buffet breakfast. What a shame the counter staff were so miserable throughout our stay. After having battled through rush-hour traffic, we would have expected at least a smile on our arrival. Not even a thank you when I paid the bill! Or maybe that is the Parisian way...

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: cricketnut29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis for 2 days at the end of our 4 week European holiday and met up with our son who is doing his Masters at London Uni and his girlfriend and tripped around Paris with them. We booked two rooms and were extremely pleased with the rooms and found them to be modern, spacious and very clean with goos prssure on the shower which came in handy at the end of a busy day walking around the streets of Paris in warm and humid temperatures. Even though the Ibis is located close to the Sacred Coeur we did not get time to pop up there despite wakling in Montmatre as we decided to spend our time walking from the hotel in Montmatre to the Louvre, and then on to the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe and down Chjamps Elysee before on the final day doing a River Seine River cruise and then going to Moulin Rouge which was an absolute disaster and major dissapointment - huge waste of money and separate review of this has been given. The Louvre museum which we spent a couple of hours in to see the normal things like the Mona Lisa and some of the artwork on the same floor as well as the Egyptian and Greek areas was value for money at 10 Euros and surprisingly despite arriicng at 11.00am the queues were small so took only a few minutes to get in and see. Paris is lovely and we cannot wait to return and the Metro system which we caught on a couple of occasions to easy to use and navigate. We had a lovely dinner at Cafe de Luna near our hotel where we enjoyed watching Barcelona thrash Man U especially as we have come from Barcelona the morning of the match. We tries Snails and frogs legs for dinner there but cannot ecommend either as something that appealed to our tastes as both were bland. However the rest of the food and of course the drinks we had were well enjoyed although like everything in Paris, expensive. It is the most expensive city we have been to by far. The hotel is in a good lcoation being close to the Metro and only two stops on the Blue Line to Gard to Nord where we caught the Eurostar back to London before going home to Auckland. Hotel Ibis and Paris are recommended highly and we hope to return to both in two years time when we return to London.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a clean place, friendly staff and great breakfast, then this is it!”
Reviews.Author: Aliandra
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of hotel reviews before deciding on the hotel for our stay in Paris. I am sure each one of us has some criterias to choose their hotel; ours were: overall good TA review, clean rooms, buffet breakfast, close to some of the Paris attractions, close to metro/bus stations, direct connection with Gare du Nord (to have an easy connection to CDG airport). Ok, we would have wanted something more romantic but this is hard to find in Paris, at a reasonable price (we looked for something around 110 Euro/night, breakfast included). When we arrived at the hotel, the receptionist was extremely nice and friendly - we could choose between in court view or view over Paris, smoking/non smoking room. We were given room 718 (non smoking, view over Paris) - we could even check in earlier (around 11 AM). At first, my husband was a little dissapointed due to the small size of the room, the small window and basic shower/lack of toiletries. Even more, when seeing we were not soo close to the other attractions (e.g. Louvre, Notre Dame). Then, little by little, the hotel started to reveal itself to us: the room was spotless clean, the bed very comfortable, the TV had Spanish channels, the small window had a secure lock (I thought this is very comforting for families with small children). Breakfast is extremely flexible and simply great!!!! We were impressed by its quality ( from the fresh pastries to Nutella or President butter). The cleaning lady did knoked at the door; if you like to stay until late in bed (i.e. more than 11AM), there is a sign with "Please do not disturb" which you can hang on the door. Towels were changed daily (unless you wished otherwise, as they are also participating in an environmental program). At the end of these 2 nights, my husband told me we could have not done a better choice for our first stay in Paris! For the budget we had, this hotel was perfect. I could not agree more.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: Cindy2001
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent, and staff was very friendly. I enjoy sleeping in on vacation. Especially when you are staying in a city with such great night life. However, between the playground next door with screaming children and what may be housekeeping cleaning upstairs, it is extremely loud. We are on the 6th floor, which we chose because of the recommendations of the view of the cemetery and Sacre Coeur. The room has absolutely no amenities that you would expect in a hotel. No toiletries except for a bottle of shampoo/soap. No pens, paper, coffee, iron, safety box, etc. You can iron and use a safety box, but downstairs in the lobby in a locked room. It is really a pain to bring your clothes down and not just press them quickly in the room before stepping out. I do like the neighborhood, and will probably stay in this area if returning to Paris, but will find another hotel. Some locals told me this neighborhood was too far from the sights, but I don't mind a 20-30 minute transit time to get into the city on the Metro. Also, the Metro never seemed very crowded, but after around 10pm there were some suspicious characters, so be alert at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: robertopareja Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with excellent location just a few steps away from metro station. We had a good nights sleep. Room is a little smaller than most Ibis hotels, but works well. I would say it's a good value for the price you pay. We heard before that the neighborhood was dangerous but it is not dangerous at all. Nice environment with a couple nice restaurants with tables to the street. Lots of activities around but the room was quiet. Very recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sazza
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 day trip to Paris and stayed in the Ibis Montmatre for 3 nights over the weekend (£173). The location of this Hotel is fantastic. Round the corner (almost litterally) is the Moulin Rouge and a little past that is the Sacre Coeur. The metro is a very short walk down the road, and resturants, bars, souvenir shops and supermarkets are all on your door step. There is also a KFC, Starbucks and McDonalds all within walking distance. Being in the red light district is not a problem as it's very busy all day and night and felt very safe wandering round at night. We were on the 6th floor with a fantastic view of the cemetary and Sacre Coeur. We didn't go into the bar or eat in the resturant as there was no need. We arrived 45 minutes before check in and thought we'd have to wait but we checked-in and were in our room with no problems at 11:30. Room was big enough for 2 people with enough space for bag and clothes, bed was comfortable and sheets changed everyday. We were given wi-fi codes on check-in, one per night we stayed, but only one code per iphone so be careful not to use all the codes on the first night they last 24hours each. Only problem we encountared was on Monday we were woken by banging at around 8:30am as (i assume) the housekeepers moved around in the rooms above and around us and were unable to sleep, this was only on the monday though not over the weekend. Overall will definitely stay here again and if you have time wander round Montartre it's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Glad i found this hotel! Wonderful stay , staff friendly and spoke english.Great breakfsat in am. Awesome location!! Metro station very close, rooms small but clean and restful. Able to walk to several tourist locations.

Reviews.Title: “Paris.. C'est du champagne, Paris... c'est de l'amour!”
Reviews.Author: Ladybugs_Lover
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ibis Montmartre in April 2011. We really enjoyed the hotel. It was value for money. We had researched quite a lot of hotels before our trip. We also consulted trip advisor (thank you to all reviewers on this site, you have helped us make informed choices!). Paris was absolutely wonderful! Its nice and easy to use public transport. In fact, from gare du nord, we took the bus to the hotel (i think it was the 54 bus -but metro is really easy to travel by). The hotel is situated close to the metro and there are lots of restaurants, supermarkets, cinemas etc, and other attractions nearby such as the Moulin Rouge. The Sacre Coeur is an absolute sight! (A must see - do try the tour on the top - i think it was about 6 euros- its well worth the sights). If you like, you can also walk up to Montmartre and have breakfast at Le Coqueliqot in the morning which will also allow you to explore the charming gravelled back alleys of Montmartre. Le Coqueliquot is a very nice boulangerie and patisserie. The vue from our hotel window was magnificent. We stayed on the 6th floor and our room overlooked the cemetry (not as morbid as it sounds believe me). And you can see the sacre coeur in the distance. Paris is absolutely grand! I hope you enjoy it. There are undoubtedly other excellent hotels out there, but the IBIs provided us with value for money and allowed us to splurge on other things. And thanks very much for the wi-fi, it worked perfectly (go down to reception every morning and get a new code).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: series_alcoholic
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with medium size rooms. some of the rooms has shower and some bath. The hotel located next to a lot of resturants, pubs and shops at a very nice place. The staff is very nice, free internet stations and a nice resturant with some games (cards and so).

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the spring”
Reviews.Author: indianad
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a long weekend and this hotel was perfect for our needs. Over looking the cemetary (second biggest in Paris, well worth a look). The hotel is just around the corner from the Molin Rouge and the metro is a short walk down the hill. In the morning we would walk over the bridge and take the first right. This is a lovely street with restarants, bars, cafes and bakeries. We would get fresh baked goods and fruit for breakfast. We also had our evening meals in the area and they were lovely. Highly recommend the hotel. My one complaint was that the taxi company they booked for our return to the train station charged €5 off our credit card and €16 for the journey. This was quite a large amount considering the journey from the station to the hotel only cost €6. Aside from this, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had stayed earlier at a location that was more on the outskirts of the city and wanted one nearer to the city center. The location was perfect, the breakfast was good, the price of the room was excellent. The room space felt a bit constricted but that I was on business and used it for sleep only did not make that a major factor. They had a decent bar but one can always get to great restaurants in less than a 5 minute walk. I would definitely recommend it to business travelers. I would stay again if I was to travel single again . Overall a great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but given the price - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Anja_Stockholm
Reviews.Content: Ibis Montmartre is a 3 star hotel in the very center of Paris. The venue is very good for a short trip / city break in Paris. The hotel is nothing fancy, but clean and well kept. The rooms are quiet. Breakfast is quite decent as well. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to see Paris in a short period if time without spending too much money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for city access - No frills hotel - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: athelia237
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Paris, and after much research for best price for value, based on trip advisor reviews, we decided to stay here. Also check-in is at noon, which was a major bonus! The hotel was pretty much what we expected, based on other reviews. It was an average hotel, nothing exceptional, but clean and the location was good. The room was small, but not cramped. We were on the highest floor, overlooking the cemetery, lots of greenery visible and from the farthest corner of the window, you could see the top of Sacre-Coeur, which was quite nice. The breakfast downstairs for 8 euros/person a day was pretty good value. Buffet style of croissants (which were actually really good), cold ham, one type of cheese, various yogurt, breads,jam, cereals, some fruit and unlimited coffee/juices and water. Staff at the hotel were not very friendly, not really unfriendly, just indifferent. Also, the internet codes we were given for access (four different ones) did not work at all. We ended up using the orange free wifi access with no code, but you do have to give an email address to register for that, and there are some limitations with it, but nothing that affected us for email or other general sites. We didn't do much in the area itself, although there are quite a few restaurants/cafes nearby, and some of them are open quite late (4-5am). Also, there is a grocery store nearby, down the street past the Moulin Rouge (on the same side of the street) which was good. There's also a small "suprette" across the street, like a convenience store, but it has less selection and is more costly than the grocery store. We found it to be a convenient location for access to the central city area, about 15 mins on the metro. Definitely a no frills hotel, but clean, decent breakfast, very close to metro stop and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again!"”
Reviews.Author: jan2france
Reviews.Content: The room was large enough for us to stow our luggage and still move around freely. Very comfortable bed. Very clean bathroom, larger than I had expected for Paris. The shower stall was bright and roomy. We had a few minor issues with the reliability of the internet. The location was convenient and we felt safe there. The Moulin Rouge is a few minutes walk down the street. There are many cafes, bars, and bakeries nearby. Close to shopping. This was my sixth visit to Paris in 3 years. I will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, terrible pillows!”
Reviews.Author: Gracie099
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Valentine's day. Its location is excellent. Very easy to get to from CDG airport-a straight train to Gare du Nord station and then a quick change on the blue line to Place du Clichy. Our room was ready early which was an advantage as we had been travelling since 4am that morning! So, after leaving our bags and a quick change, we were ready to explore the city! Place du Clichy station is only a 2 minute walk away, and the system is really easy to use to get to all of the main attractions. Our room itself was small and as mentioned in other reviews, overlooked the famous Montmarte cemetery, where the likes of Degas and other famous artists and writers are buried. This was something that didn't bother us in the slightest, but the proximity to the rooms is literally just a stone's throw away, so it may be worth requesting a different room before hand if this is something that would make you uncomfortable. Most Ibis hotels are pretty standard-no tea/coffee facilities in the room and a very weak hairdryer, so bring your own! One complaint we did have, however, were the pillows! Extremely lumpy and like sleeping on cement! Thankfully we weren't in Paris for a 'lie in' as we wouldn't have had one! The hotel is 5 minutes away from Moulin rouge and a beautiful windy, 10 minute walk to Sacre Coeur and Montmarte village. I would recommend heading up there for meals at night and lunch, rather than towards Pigalle, if you want to stay in the vicinty. Drinks and snacks in the hotel lobby were extortionately priced, so again, try to bring your own in if you need to. Overall, this hotel has a great, quirky location and we absolutely loved Paris. We'd happily stay here again, as long as we brought our own pillows!

Reviews.Title: “We plan to stay here again on our next trip.”
Reviews.Author: ccg20
Reviews.Content: This Ibis Paris Montmartre, reasonably priced, is conveniently located near the Metro, restaurants, and a supermarket. Ask for a room with a view of the cemetery. It offers a spectacular view of Montmartre. The rooms are small but not as tiny as some other family-run hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: AnCapailDubh
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 4th floor overlooking the cemetery, nice and quiet. Rooms are small enough, but not by Paris standards. Bathroom spotless, powerful shower. Metro & bus-stop just down the street. Moulin Rouge, Sacre Coeur, Pigalle a short stroll away. Staff very friendly and helpful (especially the guys on nights). Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic hotel in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: mattmtmartha
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Paris for the first time, and tried out the Ibis in Montmartre. We were very satisfied with the location as we were a short walk away from Place de Clichy metro station that took us to wherever we wanted to be in Paris. The hotel was very clean and had enough room for our two large suitcases and carry on luggage. We opted for the buffet breakfast each morning as part of our stay. Breakfast was lovely. Fresh fruit, crepes, cheese, ham, breads and pastries as well as croissants. Coffee was also available. Highly recommended if you are keen to visit the main attractions on foot or via the excellent metro system. Much relief coming from the worst in Melbourne!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near metro stations, so transport in Paris is easy. The hotel itself is ok, service reasonable, though internet through voucher didn't always worked fine. Had to use a new voucher every ten minutes because the wifi connection kept kicking me out. The rooms are small, don't expect much more then a bed and a bathroom, that's about it. Breakfast is good, and especially considering that having an outdoor breakfast in Paris can be quite expensive, the €8 p.p. is a good deal. Paid a good price using the accor website, price/quality ratio was pretty good. For the same price I paid (€180 for 3 nights) I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel - great value!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We would recomend this hotel 100% it is great value for money and very modern and very well designed. The breakfast is well worth the money and we had it every day, rooms are on the small side but very clean and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and the hotel is in a great location within easy reach of buses or the metro that takes you to main attractions within 10 minutes. Eating out can be expensive - look at the back of menus for special offers these are great! there is a lovely cafe on the corner of the road near the hotel which is very resonable and does very tasty food. Paris is lovely, and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent”
Reviews.Author: TraLonW
Reviews.Content: Location excellent - nearest metro a minute away. Decent restaurants and bars close by. Few minutes walk to Moulin Rouge, Sacre Coeur. Our room was to back of hotel so very quiet indeed. Although room small, beds were comfortable and, unlike some other Ibis hotels where we have stayed, the bathroom a good size. Breakfast was plentiful. Only downside to the hotel is the bar is totally devoid of atmosphere so try the Mercure next door for a nightcap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dgosul
Reviews.Content: Arrived Friday Night 21st Jan at 20.00,very efficient check in,got a room on the 8th floor a nice quiet one,when we entered the room, there was a bottle of Champagne , bowl of fruit,2 glasses & a bowl of savory crisps waiting for us with a note as i had emailed earlier in the week to say we were celebrating an event.What a lovely gesture.When you get up from Place de Clichy metro you can see the IBIS sign, so its very easy find the hotel,will definately stay here again,perfect area for bars & scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, good priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saz_Beautyspot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ibis Montmartre for a week last week with my boyfriend. I booked and paid online and when we got there the reception staff were amazing (a girl named Lisa). Quick check in, she was helpful with our internet and tips on where to go and what to do. The room was great. Not too small as most would say. Bed was really comfortable. The room overall was very clean. Bathroom was lovely as wekk, with a bath and mirror and hot water (LOL!) it was cold in Paris so the room was nice and warm. Breakfast was great, I reccommend you actually get breakfast with your booking, it's worth it. They didn't have eggs though but otherwise there was everything you need to start your day. They have a decent bar/restaurant in the hotel. And although the hotel is in Montmartre its not exactly in the red light district so you don't see anything shady at night. An absolutely great location with the metro a couple of minutes away on foot, shops and restaurants all around, and Moulin Rouge is only 3 minutes away on foot, literally. Only downside was the lack of electric outlets in the room, but my bf and I were prepared with an adapter and power extension for phone chargers, laptop etc. Internet WIFI is free and very efficient. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ldeeDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and it was perfect - not a bad thing to say about the hotel. We checked in quickly and with no problem thanks to the lovely staff, and our room was excellent. It was very clean and not big, but not tiny either. The bathroom was nice, a lovely spacious shower and a big mirror. Also a hairdryer on the wall in the bathroom. The bed was absolutely huge and very comfortable! Nice flat screen tv with lots of channels. The hotel is literally two mins walk from a metro station and while we didn't explore the immediate surrounding area, it seemed ok. Was very impressed with breakfast - a great and tasty selection of breads, ham, jams, cheese, cereal, yogurt, juices etc. Typical breakfast food but top quality. Overall, a lovely stay in a nice clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money - good location”
Reviews.Author: weloveperth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 2 weeks' holiday in London & Paris over the Christmas and New Year's and I did quite a bit of research about the hotels in both cities. Our budget was around Euro120 per night, and my requirements were simple: good location near some sights, near a metro station and CLEAN. The Ibis Montmartre seemed to be all 3 from the reviews on Tripadvisor. The Ibis did not disappoint. We stayed here on our last leg of our Paris holiday, after staying in a nice rather expensive hotel in London and Eiffel Seine near the Eiffel Tower for the 1st leg of Paris, and I was still quite impressed with what the Ibis had to offer. It was clean and the bathroom (i requested for standing shower only, with no bathtub) was spotless. The location was good for going to Moulin Rouge (we went to the 11pm show which ended around 1pm & we walked back to Ibis, felt very safe). We also walked to Sacre Couer which was a short & beautiful walk (we walked past the cemetery and a residential area & reached the back of Sacre Couer). And with the very efficient metro, it was easy to go just about everywhere. While Eiffel Seine has a nicer bed & pillows, little touches such as a nice closet, tea & coffee, mini fridge and gorgeous decor, the room in Ibis was actually slightly larger and had a lot more restaurants and shops around the area. We liked walking around the Montmartre area whereas there weren't a lot of restaurants/cafes/shops around the Eiffel Seine area. My only gripes were: flat & tiny pillows (I'm asian and am a very tiny girl too!), i requested for a view that doesn't overlook the cemetery and got one that was facing a courtyard but the problem was that it was facing the Mercure hotel lifts lobbies and hence the curtain was drawn all the time but really who cares since we were out & about most of the time. Overall, if you are on a budget and are looking for a decent hotel as a base in Paris, I would highly recommend the Ibis Montmartre. Do make sure that you are booking the one on Rue Caulaincourt as there is a smaller Ibis near Moulin Rouge which is situated right in the middle of all the sex shops etc & nearer the Pigalle Metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Very Solid Hotel- but wifi certainly has its limitations- no VOIP allowed”
Reviews.Author: saxophonegirl78
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Ibis this past week. The location is excellent, rooms are immaculate, we found breakfast to be a very good value, great service, and the beds are very comfortable. The only drawbacks that I could find were: Pillows were very small and flat- I had to fold mine in half to get it close to a normal height for me, but I am 6'0". I woke up with some minor neck pain each morning, though. Bring your own pillow! Wifi was free, but it has a daily data limit (200MB per day sent/received) and prohibits VOIP calls. We had to enter an elaborate code/password combo each time we used it, and had to get a new code from the front desk every day of our stay, too. For one or two days, that's fine, but it was starting to get annoying around day 4 or 5. We had just come from Istanbul, where our wifi was free flowing and we were able to make cheap Skype calls back home. I guess we were spoiled there. The wifi situation was a bit frustrating, but it wouldn't stop me from staying here again. Overall, a lovely hotel in a great location with a very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good morning,”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good morning, I stay last week 3 night in your hotel I was before already several times in your hotel also whit groups. Now is my question why you renovate your restaurant and breakfast room. I found the old one much nicer this is now cold and no atmosphere? Not every change is on inproofment.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE, GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Rastaman79
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, just a few steps from the place de clichy subway station and a 5-minutes walk from the famous molin rouge. Front desk girls were helpful and friendly. We got a just-refurbished room so everything was clean and working properly. The room and toilet were big enough, the bed was very confortable, Internet wifi system worked perfectly, heating was powerful enough to create a warm environment and we had a LCD TV. Our room faced the back of the hotel, so we did not hear any annoying noise at nights. Although not the cheapest hotel, it offers a good value for the money. We found the breakfast to be a little pricy so we did not eat in the hotel (there are plenty of places to eat around the hotel). PROS: Friendly staff. Great location. Clean rooms. CONS: Bad smell in the bathroom, comming from the sewerage. Would definitely come back if returning to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location good, but do not expect typical IBIS standard”
Reviews.Author: defMunichCanyonRider
Reviews.Content: For some reasons, the Accor hotel in Paris do not reach the standards I know from Germany. Overall it was ok. We had some trouble regarding the reservation, but the rest was ok. Strange was, that they have air condition but there is an extra heater (which I could not turn off or set the temperature. So I had the "regulate" extra with the air condition. The small table at the window was extremly cold, I guess the isolation is very poor. Wifi was ok (free). The breakfast was also ok. So just for one or two night not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent for Montmartre, Paris”
Reviews.Author: PortoExplorer
Reviews.Content: Paris is not a cheap city to sleep or eat. Being Montmartre such a touristic and amazing place, the options to get a great deal turn to be hard to find – so, this Ibis, similar as many others turn to be a great experience to stay in Paris, at Montmartre área. The building is modern, 5 min walk to Place Clichy metro stop (that leads you to wherever you want in Paris in some few minutes); almost same distance to Moulin Rouge, Rue Lepic, Bvl Clichy; very close to Place du Tertre (the artists área), Pigalle, Sacré-Coeur, Vigne de Montmartre… Inside, the hotel facilities are quite modern and functional. Our room was in 5th floor, very modern, the regular Ibis double, very quiet at night, spacious enough, very clean, great WC as well with nice bath system, excelent shower pressure with hot water everytime. Good rate for Paris at their website, the Happy 20 non refundable special rate, no breakfast included (there are several cafés in the área) – 154€ for 2 nights/double room. To improve: More efficiency with their Room Card Key at the lift (you have to insert it to go up, but not always works properly); more towels in the bathroom (only 2 towels for bath and hands for 2 persons); better TV image. After all, we liked very much and we shall come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “SELF SERVICE TO THE EXTREME”
Reviews.Author: Persimmone
Reviews.Content: When I checked into my room, discovered mysterious black stain on toilet seat - cleaned off myself with wet tissues. When I showered, the bath water flooded down to the floor, as the drainage hole in the shower stall was blocked. I then spent 15 minutes mopping up the water and wringing it into the toilet bowl - to prevent damage to the vinyl flooring in the rest of the bathroom, where there was NO drainage - if I had not done so, the water would have remained to a half-inch depth and possibly caused damage to the vinyl floor. When I went out for dinner, I mentioned the incident to Reception. She offered to provide me with lots of towels to mop up the water! No apologies! not a word of concern! and no housekeeping service? Extended another half day stay - but my room card access, also to lift, was not extended. I went up to my floor with fellow guest who used his pass - then discovered I could not get into my room. Tried to go down to reception via elevator - not able to do so as my card had no access anymore. Was therefore trapped on my floor until another guest on my floor used the lift. There should be emergency phone on every floor.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good value”
Reviews.Author: clerical
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location with good transport links for the city Clean rooms Pleasant staff Comfortable bed Good value for money Cons: Pillows not very comfortable Key card for room and lift was very erratic Overall a pleasant place to stay and a good base for sightseeing at a reasonable place. Would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SG1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Ibis Montmatre in October 2010. The hotel is very close to the metro station Place de Clichy which serves lines 2 & 13. The location was good as it wasn't far from Gare du Nord on line 2 & very easy to get to the central sights via line 13. The hotel was good value for Paris. As mentioned by other reviewers the hotel is basic, but perfectly adequate. Our room had a double & single bed and overlooked the Montmatre Cemetery, therefore it was quiet at night. The breakfast was good value at Euro 7.50. There was plenty on offer including: croissants, bagettes, ham, cheese etc. It did get busy so better to arrive earlier. Overall we had a good short trip to Paris and the Ibis was exactly as expected. If you are on a budget and want a relatively modern hotel then this is a reasonable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Subway is close, breakfast is cheap, tons of Bars and Restaurants at night”
Reviews.Author: atorres42
Reviews.Content: Ibis is Ibis wherever you go. This one is particurlary good because is close from main attractions (by subway) and is located on Montmartre, a very funny site of Paris. So, if you don't plan to stay at your hotel, this one is a very good option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable”
Reviews.Author: AnastasM
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, stayed there for a week with wife and small child (in a 3 bed room). Walking distance from Montmartre, good connection with metro and busses. Loved it, would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “No charm, but value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mats55
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a charming and romantic Paris hotel, this is nothing for you. But if you can accept a modern and clean hotel and at a decent price, I can certainly recommend this hotel. Rooms are small, as most Parisian hotels. Don't bring to many big bags. Beds are comfortable and the room is very quiet, no disturbance from neighbours. Rooms have air-con, but we had no need to use it. Paris in November is a bit chilly in the evenings. Staff is friendly and helpful and speak English. The surrounding area feels safe and it's a short walk to the Metro. Moulin Rouge is just a few blocks away, and Sacre Coeure is also on walking distance, but beware, it's up the hills. Buy a Metro-pass, Paris visit, and travel as much as you like on the Metro and buses. Breakfast is good, nothing special but worth the money. Free wifi, or 15 minutes free internet at the computers in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Small & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Oscar4u
Reviews.Content: Location: less than 500M from Metro Place de Clichy. Save a lot of energy if you come by metro. A lot of restaurants and fast food chain (Quick, MC, KFC) and Starburg, Flunch is a famous place for the locals for dinner. Near to Moulin Rouge. Check in / check out: Always long queue, means they have good business. Room: Good: Clean, value Bad: Too small, no kettle, shower water wasy to split out Breakfast: Didnt try, plenty food to east outside Other service: 2 computers in the lobby with free access to internet (limited to 15 minutes and need to relogin)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Very Clean Best Value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: get0uttat0wn
Reviews.Content: I booked the Ibis Monmartre based on reviews from Trip Advisor. It was exactly what I was looking for: a basic hotel that was clean and in a good location. I was able to walk to everything from this hotel. If you are not in shape don’t take this literally as most attractions are not within normal person walking distance. There is a nearby metro station that can take you anywhere. Also there was nearby Velib stations if you wanted to take a bike. The hotel was a few hundred meters from the Moulin Rouge and the staff was very helpful when I needed to book and print my show ticket on line. The room is basic but very clean and recently renovated. I had a charming view of the Montmartre cemetery out my window. The hotel was a short uphill walk to the Sacre Coeur and all the shops and restaurants there. Enjoyed morning runs along the bike paths that are in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny rooms and not so bad service”
Reviews.Author: HarshaVardhan
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Paris with my wife along with another couple for a holiday in Sep/Oct 2009 and stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. We booked this hotel based on reviews and price and the picture of the hotel on their website. The hotel is located centrally close to Sacre-coeur,Arc de Triomphe, walkable distance to MRT/bus stop and Moulin rouge. There are restaurants and pubs by dozens (including Persian, Mc Donalds to several french restaurants) around the hotel. The house keeping staff ensured the rooms were clean through out our stay. The staff were quite friendly, break-fast is quite good but the disappointment was the size of the room. Typically people going to Europe for a holiday carry lots of luggage to accomodate woolens and the hotel rooms were so tiny that we could not even open our suitcases completely. I've been told that most hotels in Paris are small but this one was way too small. So, if you are a biz traveller going on short visit to Paris with less luggage, this hotel makes sense but certainly not for a leisure traveller with family.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: jivegirl
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a few ibis hotels we knew what to expect. Clean, value for money no surprises little character.Travelling with our 9 year old for a couple of days we wanted something we could rely on. Great location near to the metro stop of Place de Clichy. Modern purpose built building shared with seperate hotel Mercure (same chain) next door. Lovely atmospheric views over the Montmartre cemetery which added a little of the missing character to the hotel. The staff at reception were welcoming and helpful. My attempt at French to give our names and reservation details seemed appreciated though all staff we spoke to had good English. We had a room with very comfortable King sized and single bed. The room was compact but weve been in much smaller and this was good for Paris. We were going to eat out for breakfast but the breakfast at the hotel was very good value and enabled us to take something for our son when he got the munchies later. A good selection of pastries,hams,spanish omelette,fruit yoghurts etc which was better value than the croissant and coffee down the road. (Unless that is literally all you want) At the time of our stay part of the breakfast/bar area was being renovated but there was no inconvenience. Easy walk to Montmartre or take the metro to Abesses. It is probably more interesting to walk as you caqn see the shops and restaurants and find some lovely nooks and crannies to explore.On seeing the traditional carousel at the bottom of Montmartre our son said that he was too old for most carousels but not too old for a double decker one like that! You can also easily get to the Pigalle area if this floats your boat. We were not walking too late at night and the area around the Moulin Rouge was fine mainly packed with Tourists and students. Our son was more interesting in standing on the metro air vent opposite the Moulin Rouge and letting the air gush up (like the other tourists) rather than noticing anything less salubrious. Dont miss standing on the steps of Sacre Coeur up the hill and look at the views of Paris. If you want to see the Eiffel tower light up then move over to the area past the funicular stop, at the top by a little park, and stand at the railings.You can only see the Eiffel tower from there not on the Sacre Coeur steps. When we visited it lit up after dusk on the hour for ten minutes a time. It is cheesy but magical! There are plenty of places to eat around the area either right by the hotel or further up by Sacre Coeur. The only thing we were not prepared for at the end was that though you can leave your luggage after check out until you leave it is in secure coin operated lockers so you need to have 5 Euros. At least it was secure. All in all a great place to stay .If you want character or boutique touches then don't stay in an Ibis.We thought it was great for our needs and exploring Montmartre each evening and hanging about on the butte added a different more villagey atmosphere to our trip and contrasted to our days out in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Good Location - Overall a positive experience.”
Reviews.Author: BKearns
Reviews.Content: I was a long time searching online for a hotel in Paris. The trip was part business and part pleasure, and the cost was coming from my own pocket, so I was looking for somewhere affordable, but at the same time, somewhere that would be a good base for exploring Paris and for preparing work using my PC. Other reviews for hotels in the ~EU120 price range were downright scary! It seems that Paris is very expensive for accommodation, and that sub-standard budget accommodation is the norm. In any case, when I found IBIS on the net, I was surprised by the generally positively reviews, and decided to give it a try. First point - Location. The best location in Paris would be around the station Chatalet Les Halles in the centre of Paris. The train from the airport brings you directly there. Unfortunately, the hoteliers around Chatalet seem to be aware of this, so you are unlikely to find anywhere in that area costing less than EU200 per night. The train from the airport also stops at Gare du Nord, on the north east side of the city. However, it's not an ideal place to stay for sightseeing - there is not much around there to see! I thought that Mont Martre was an ideal compromise. It is a train ride from the airport to Gare du Nord, followed by one trip on the metro to the station Place de Clichy on the blue line. Mont Martre is the artisan quarter of Paris, and you will find there the kind of ambience and character that is quintessentially Parisian and which may be lacking from other more upmarket regions. There are lots of family-run restaurants in Mont Martre with terraces which will serve “croissants avec café Au lait” as required. If you're there on a Sunday, take a stroll to Sacre Coeur, and sit inside the church during a service to soak up the atmosphere and the resonant sonority of the tremendously large stone enclosure that forms the main vault. The hotel is a 5 min walk from the metro station, along a main road, so it is easy to find. The sign for IBIS can be seen from the station. Rooms: The funny thing is that IBIS and Mercure Hotel are actually the same building. Mercure Hotel is substantially more expensive. Both hotels have their own lifts and reception, and breakfast areas; however, they seem to have allocated the smaller rooms to IBIS and the larger rooms to Mercure. The IBIS rooms seem mostly to be on the upper floors (mine was on the 6th floor) and they mostly overlook the Mont Martre cemetery - not the best view. However, the room size was fine for two people. King size bed, small desk, clean bathroom with shower (no bath). There are no tea making facilities in the room, which was a slight annoyance, and the internet (which is free) required a USERID and PASSWORD and seemed to be scheduled to time out too frequently. On one of the evenings when I arrived, the internet service was down, which was a problem as I had some emails to send. The rooms have air conditioning, which worked fine for me, and windows which can be opened. The TV had one English channel (BBC World), and a lot of Frensh terrestrial rubbish, that would be of little interest to the non-native guests. Other features: There is not much in the line of frills about this hotel - but there are free-to-use PCs in the lobby for people who haven't brought their own PC. Also the breakfast room is a decent size, and the breakfast was not bad value for EU7.50. There are vending machines in the lobby too, but don't waste your money there, as there is a late night store directly across the road from the hotel which sells snacks, and which has a good selection of French Wines too. For breakfast or evening meals, there is a vast selection along the roade to the metro station Place de Clichy, or along the road to the Moulin Rouge. Plenty of adult shops in the area around the Moulin Rouge too, but there isn't the intimidating atmosphere of red light districts in other cities I've visited. Some of the restaurants are more foreigner friendly than others, so the best thing to do is to move on if you are greeted by a surly waiter who pretends not to understand words like COFFEE or BREAKFAST! Overall, good value, good location and a positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, uncomplicated accommodation”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMuppet
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed in an Ibis before in any country you'll know exactly what to expect: compact rooms that are comfortable, very clean but with absolutely no frills. The multilingual receptionists were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was absolutely fine although if you're willing to look around, there are more interesting options in the area. The hotel is very close to Place de Clichy on Metro line 4, which is about half a dozen stops from Étoile Charles de Gaulle (Arc de Triomphe) in one direction and about 3 stops from Anvers for the Sacré Coeur.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, neat & tidy, you get what you are expecting!”
Reviews.Author: NilakshiS
Reviews.Content: The check-in process was a good experience, and we were pleasantly surprised by the fact that they had smoking rooms (with two smokers, that's important!). Prior to leaving on our holiday, I had had an email exchange with the hotel staff and made certain requests. However, none of these requests were noted against our booking. We got what we wanted but only after repeating our requests at the time of check in. Defeats the whole purpose of making the effort to make requests in advance! The room itself was nice - not very big (as expected in Paris), but neat & clean. It had a huge window over-looking the Montmartre Cemetery - we were up on the 8th floor, so mostly saw only tree tops - but that was a nice view, as well! The bathroom was small but very well finished and laid out so there was no problem using it. We could not figure out the heating system for the room - but since it was not too cold, we did not even bother to try very hard. We were, fortunately, instructed on how to use the lift - put the room key into the slot, then press the button for the floor you want to go to. But, during our stay there we noticed that several groups of people had not been told about this and were just going up and down in the lift with no clue as to why the lift was not stopping at the floor they wanted. We opted against the breakfast, instead just helped ourselves to the vending machine coffee - which was quite good. The only thing about the hotel that we found we didn't like and/or appreciate, was the overall lack of understanding of the English language so communication was not very easy (fortunately we had no problems and did not need to communicate very much). In a hotel in a place like Paris, which gets visitors from all over the world, I believe it is absolutely essential that the staff speak and understand a fair amount of English. Some of the staff at the reception were a little rude (we were there 4 nights so interacted with a lot of the staff). There is Free Wireless Internet, but again the staff can not explain how to use it. We were not carrying a laptop and I wanted to use the Wifi through my mobile, but other than saying 'Open Orange', no one seemed to know what to do. So, we didn't end up using the Internet facility. Check-out was very quick! Location is great - and the metro station being so close is also a huge plus. Overall, after reading hundreds and hundreds of reviews, I am glad we chose to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Corkwoman
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on hundreds of hotels in Paris and finally, based on the price, and the number of positive comments I'd found, I finally chose the Ibis Montmartre to be the staging ground for our family's weekend in Paris. With a group of twelve (youngest a toddler and oldest in the mid-seventies) it was a challenge to find something to suit the needs of everyone, but I really feel like this hotel did just that. It is a short walk downhill to the Metro, and the Metro was how we traveled everywhere (the only way to go!). At night when we needed to get taxis home from the city center, the cost was around 12 Euro. The rooms were small, but had everything we needed. This hotel has triple rooms, which was a great plus for us, traveling with such a large group. I had pleasant and easy communication by email with the staff prior to our arrival, ensuring that all our rooms were close to each other (and they were). No nasty surprises - everything was as advertised, including the cost. The breakfast buffet is a great value and I highly recommend it. Good hotel, good location, good price. As a side note, might I advise those of you traveling to Paris for sight seeing to actually take the advice you read everywhere and buy the tickets to Versailles in advance of getting there! I didn't, and ended up in line for an hour and a half! Also, bring a back pack and pack a picnic. There are ample picnic opportunities in Paris and you will feel very chuffed with yourself, sitting in a green space, feasting on crusty baguettes, cheese and meats, washed down with some Vin Ordinaire. Not only is it a cost effective way to eat, but it also feels very Parisian!

Reviews.Title: “Solid, good-value hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: treiber86
Reviews.Content: Had a few troubles at check in. Apparently I had made three bookings but later found out that there were three people staying in the hotel with the same name as me! Why they couldn't have just looked at the booked dates (surely these people didn't have the exact same dates as me) is beyond me. However, after arriving at the room, I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness, and even the size, of the room. It featured a full-size bed, desk and chair and good hanging space. The bathroom was modern and shower good. The air-conditioning worked well. A bar fridge would have been nice. I found the breakfast to be only average. The baked goods were dry and unpleasant. Much better to head to one of the boulangeries on Rue des Abbesses (I recommend Le Grenier à Pain). Overall, I had a pleasant stay at the Ibis. I just couldn't shake the feeling that the staff didn't really know what was going on most of the time. Be sure to ask for a room that looks over the cemetery. You get a view of Sacre Coeur if you turn your head!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well run hotel in a perfect location - good value in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: JochP
Reviews.Content: Priceworthy hotel in the charming Montmartre, close to Sacre Coeur and Moulin Rouge is just around the corner. Near all the cafées and restaurants in the street of Rue des Abbesses. Ok distance for walking down to the city centre of Paris (we walked everyday for four days). Staff friendly and welcoming. The room (and the bathroom) was clean and well tidied. The room was a bit small but we did not expect more in a city like Paris so it was a perfect place to stay during the nights. Breakfast buffe was not the best but ok - typical french with a lot of sweet croissants and really fat youghurt. Same stuff every morning. We would definitely recommentd this hotel. Maybe not to the couple seeking the most romantic and luxurious stay in and old and charming Parisian building (which will cost a lot) but rather for those seeking a priceworthy and normal standard place to stay in Paris pretty close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms - noisy hotel. Great breakfast though.”
Reviews.Author: acs2703
Reviews.Content: Just stayed Aug 2010. Check in was an utter disaster - took over an hour as they had messed up our reservation - then gave us a key for an already occupied room and eventually got us to go away for an hour until they could sort it out. No apologies, just poor communication. The rooms are VERY small - just squeeze around the bed. Toilet/shower okay - shower was weak with temp varying all the time. Hotel was also very noisy with poor sound insulation - banging of doors, lifts etc all through the night so if you are a light sleeper I would avoid. Saving grace of stay was the breakfast - very good value for Paris and excellent quality. Coffee was excellent and very good fruit, pastries, bread etc so at least the hotel scored very highly on this. Location was pretty good - 20 mins walk up the steep hills to Sacre Coer and easy access to Metro for everywhere else - we walked to all the main landmarks such as Eiffel Tower. All in all I would say you could do a lot worse for the price but hard to fully recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: opack
Reviews.Content: Typical Ibis Hotel. Ideally located close to Montmatre (walking distance to the top around 30min) and public transport. (bus/subway to Arc de Triomphe around 10 minutes). Rooms were quite spacious, nice and clean. Staff was friendly. A lot of restaurants and pubs are close to the hotel inclduing Moulin Rouge.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Segstar
Reviews.Content: My friend and I travelled fron London to Paris for a 4 night girly break away. This hotel was great, it is in a brilliant location. It is very close to metro stations (Place de Clichy being the closest), there is practically everything you could need within a minutes' walk- restaurants, coffee shops, pharmacies, bars , a supermarket etc. The hotel itself is very clean and modern and has seven floors. I feel as though I got great value for money and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely appropriate for my stay”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Khan_Bham
Reviews.Content: I was meeting friends in Paris for an annual get-together and on their recommendation chose this great Ibis in Montmartre - just around the corner from the Moulin Rouge and a few minutes' walk from the Sacré Cœur. The staff were friendly and complimented me on my French - always a way into my good books! They were extremely helpful when I asked for a charger for my 'phone (they had a box full left behind by forgetful guests) I will definitely visit again - it was excellent value and I saved both time and money by not having to use the Métro.

Reviews.Title: “Definately will return”
Reviews.Author: Prepar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and well located. Though the rooms were small they were very clean. The only thing which I did not like about the hotel is the child bedding in our room. There was a shelf above the bed and my daughter banged into it in the sleep and got up in the morning with a bump. Metro was just a few meters away (about 2-3 mins) which was the most convinient. The place also has lot of eateries and Supermarkets.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!!”
Reviews.Author: Iets
Reviews.Content: We where there for 4 days. We only have good memories. Great service, super nice staff, great breakfast. Simply the best!!!! Best regards

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good value - but don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: travel_momentum
Reviews.Content: The rooms are pretty small, but clean, well-kept and cheerful. No safe or mini-fridge, and there are only 2 electricity outlets (which are not even well placed), but otherwise we had a comfortable stay. Though the hotel is located near a busy intersection which was under construction at the time, we didn't have an issue with noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: JulioAna
Reviews.Content: The location of this Hotel Ibis Paris Montmartre is good, near transports and shopping (but this is common feature of hotels in Paris). Beware about the room that you will choose, because there are just two options: rooms located towards the graveyard (Montmartre cemetery), and rooms located towards the inner part of the building (no views, except other windows). The front rooms belong to the Mercury Hotel which is located at the same building. Although French people has adquired a reputation for bad mood, I have found sympathetic people most of the time in Paris, it may be due to the fact that I always tried to speak in French. People on the street are not required to speak a foreign language or to be nice, but employees of a hotel must be. The weakest points of this IBIS are the quality of training and the lack of friendliness for its employees. When I complained that the heater in my room was not working, the woman who attendanted me was sarcastic, as it was impossible for someone to feel cold in spring at Paris. Only on the next day, when I complained again about the cold in my room, another attendant offered me a portable heater. Another situation occured on my check-out day, when I woke up very early and needed to have the breakfast at the hotel; I was not worry about the early time because the information was that the breakfast would start at 06:30, but when I arrived at the restaurant it was in the dark and an employee served us just some few options. Another employee who actually "opened" the restaurant muttered all the time and had a bad mood, it was very unpleasant. I will not come back to IBIS Montmartre: there are many hotels in Paris presenting similar price and accommodations with better training and friendly staff. By the way: IBIS presents a policy about client satisfaction intitled "Satisfied or your room's on us". Do not trust on this!!! I did not know about this policy because it was my first experience with IBIS and the employees did not tell me about it. When I was back home I saw about this policy in the IBIS website and wrote them about the incident with my room heater in Paris. They recognized their mistake, but instead of sending me a voucher for a free-day room, they send me a voucher of 15 €!!! Perhaps this voucher would pay a one-day breakfast at some IBIS... This is the announcement that IBIS does on its website: "Guaranteed Maximum of 15 Minutes. Have a problem? So we've devised a satisfaction guarantee*: if you encounter a problem in your room, we promise to make things right as quickly as possible no matter what time it is. Your problem's resolved in 15 minutes, or your room's on us! *The 15-minute satisfaction guarantee applies to the breakfast, the room, the snacks and the bar." Do not trust on this!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that is like American hotels...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that is like American hotels. Short walk to metro. Alot of construction going on, not a big deal. Rooms spacious and hot spacious showers. Would stay here again if staying for a length of time, because it is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - shame about the internet”
Reviews.Author: nikkivn
Reviews.Content: I had to find a hotel quick after being stuck in Paris for 2 extra nights. A friend recommended the Ibis, and I thought it looked a good choice; central location, easy access to the Metro, reasonably priced and free internet which I needed to check on flights, and on my emails for business. The room was clean and tidy, but sparse; think Travelodge style accommodation. But the money spent, ideal. Location was excellent, 5 minute walk from the Metro; ask for a front facing room if you don't want to look over the graveyard!! The only quibble I had was the "free" internet. You had to ask for a pass at reception; it says "During your stay, enjoy free Wi-Fi access, in your room, in the entrance hall for 24 consecutive hours with the Pass Day." I had my laptop so was easy to connect. But after about an hour, I got booted off. No bother, sign back on - no, it said I had used all my hours!! Over a 48 hour period I had to go to reception about 6 times to get new passes! At one time, the male receptionist said the pass was only for an hour of free time...... yeah right, that's NOT what it says on the pass! On checking out, I wanted to leave my luggage with the hotel as my flight wasn't until 6 that night but my large suitcase wouldn't fit in their (Chargable) luggage leave. Fortunately I think they took pity on me and let me leave my luggage in their office! I would definitely use this hotel, and the Ibis chain in future. Please just sort the net access!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: doug82
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Paris in March with my fiancée and chose the ibis to be our base for the 4 days. It is ideally located only a 2 minute walk to the nearest subway and main street in Montmartre. The room was small but had everything we needed and was kept very clean. The shower was excellent and certainly wakes you up in the morning!! The Continental Buffet breakfast was an ideal start to each day with a good variety to choose from and the staff are very attentive. We went the Moulin Rouge which is about 5-10 minute walk from the hotel; this is a must when visiting Paris, although a bit pricey I had a fantastic night so would definitely recommend it. This hotel is ideal for somewhere clean, comfortable, reliable and not too pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very comfortable room/bed, never slept so well in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Babs1973
Reviews.Content: I have wonderful memories of this hotel and I've been to a few in Paris. Sure there's nothing romantic or charming about an Ibis Hotel, it's a big white block building overlooking the Montmartre cemetery but I've never slept so well. The rooms are small but very functional and have been recently renovated. I asked for a quiet room not facing the busy street (rue Coulaincourt) and I got one overlooking the cemetery...gloomy you might think but it's actually very nice, quiet and full of trees. The breakfast buffet is great and is served until late, there's even a special breakfast service for those who need to leave very early. The location is also great, and with the metro station just meters away you can reach any part of Paris within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Douglas_SP_Brazil
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife for 4 days in sep 2009. It's a standard Ibis hotel with a good service, a terrific breakfast. I didn't have any problem with the staff, all of them attend me very kindly in English. The hotel is well placed in the Montmartre district, a very lovely place. It's very near from Moulin Rouge. There are two subway stations (Blanche and Place de Clichy) about 500 meters from hotel. It's a very good choice if you want a good hotel but don't want to spend too much money.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshirespud
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at the Ibis Montmartre in April. We chose this hotel because we have stayed in Ibis hotels before and have always found them to be good value and for the location, near to the Moulin Rouge and Montmartre. This Ibis is not new and is not as good as many others we have used. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful but the rooms, whilst clean, are very small and basic in terms of furniture. There is no drawer space and little wardrobe space. The television would only tune to French speaking channels, no Sky or BBC news channels. Breakfast is acceptable, but continental only. We ate once in the restaurant and again this was acceptable but nothing special. For a really good dinner we would recomment La Luna which is just fifty yards away on the corner of Place de Clichy, excellent food and a really friendly welcome. For entertainment do not miss the Moulin Rouge, it may be expensive but is a fabulous show and well worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, horrible bed”
Reviews.Author: GENTguy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. Only bed point was the bed (the most important thing?:(). I am 191cm, and the bed was tooooo short. At the head of the bed was a wooden bit (night-table). Really unhandy during the sleep. Pillows were also a bad quality. Strange, that there is difference between Ibis hotels in different countries, cause so far I had great experience with Ibis...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Harshvardhan_s
Reviews.Content: Ibis Montmartre was a nice hotel near place de clichy metro station. The hotel was clean, and cheerful with pleasant surroundings and great connectivity. The room was a little small but nice and comfortable. Overall i think it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Search no more!”
Reviews.Author: TOTHEALEX
Reviews.Content: My wife convinced me to stay at the hotel and we never felt sorry for making this choice. 1) It is located at the heart of MontMartre - within walking distance to Sacre Coire - and 2 minutes away from metro 2) Staff at the reception is very, very polite and helpful 3) Rooms are quiet and cozy (and they are big by French standards) 4) Breakfast is excellent We stayed at 2 hotels during our stay in Paris. One - 2 star Ibis, 2nd - 3 star "boutique" French hotel (more expensive, actually). We realized that 3 star French hotel was worse in terms of location, food, room size and staff - ended up going back to Ibis. BUT - ask for a room with a street or cemetary view! - You don't want to be facing another room - that makes a whole difference. Luckily, the hotel staff was very helpful and we easily changed our room to the one with the view. And the rooms are very quiet, really! I would highly recommend this option to anyone - Place de Clichy is absolutely wonderful at night, restaurants, cafes, nice atmosphere. And metro is very close! So - search no more!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Don't even hesitate!”
Reviews.Author: 2Xist
Reviews.Content: We split our stay in Paris into two hotels: Ibis Paris Montmartre (2 stars) and Tryp Blanche Fontaine (3 stars). WHAT A MISTAKE!!! Next time in Paris (what will never happen again - not because of the hotel, but because of Paris itself) I would stay only in this Ibis hotel, or any other Ibis with good reviews. We stayed on 9th floor overlooking at Monmartre cemetery, Sacre Coeur hill and other areas of Paris. The room was rather spacious, quite basic, no fridge, a TV set, well heated (a wall-mounted powerful heater is provided in the room) and ventilated. Noise insulation was good – we never heard our neighbors. All our nights were completely calm and peaceful, no noise from the street, as there was a cemetery below. A double bed was very comfortable and rather firm, what is good for a backbone. They provided a second duvet on request - I do not like to share one duvet with my wife. Pillows were ok. The bathroom was quite spacious, clean and nice, with a hair dryer, a sink, a bath tub, toilet. Good water pressure. We experienced no discomfort in the bathroom. Minor issues: sometimes shower water got hotter than adjusted, so required adjusting from time to time while taking a shower. And another issue - - a floor in the bathroom is covered with a linoleum, not tiles. An elevator is enough for 6 to 8 people. So, no complaints about an elevator. On the 6th and 7th floor they were doing renovation work, but they started at 9 am except Sundays. That was not a problem, as we left before 9 am. Even if we stayed in, it didn’t bother us. Who wants cheaper meals – a Flunch chain buffet (open 11 am to 10 pm) is in the same building (see my fotos). They serve various meal at reasonable price, but food is very very basic and average, even junk (its plus is price only, not the taste). For comparison, onion soup is Paris cafes and restaurants costs 6 to 9 euros. Flunch serve grilled beef steak with an unlimited amount of salad, chips, mashed potato, beans, some other cooked vegetables (all you can pick as much as you want) for 8 euros. Steak (with salad and chips) in Paris cafes costs about 13 to 25 euros. But do not confuse steak with beef hache – hache is a minced meat like in a burger. There are two mini supermarkets on Boulevard de Batignolles – 5 to 10 minutes walk from the hotel on the left side of the boulevard . Another big supermarket Carrefour (63 Boulevard de Rochechouart, 75009 Paris, France) –walk on Boulevard de Clichy to Pigalle, pass Pigalle and walk one more block (the supermarket will be on the right side if walking from the hotel). Quite a good supermarket. You can buy there hot grill chicken or anything you want. It is about 15 minutes walk from the hotel. There is another supermarket you pass on the way to Carrefour - this is Monoprix. We saw a mouse in a food department , be alert.

Reviews.Title: “Ottimo”
Reviews.Author: 1planete
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at this hotel last october for the second time, we love Montmartre, perfect clean bedrooms , enough breakfast, we fell in love with the paper profiles cut scissors artists,we suggest this hotel as right in the center of everything you may need to visit and see.

Reviews.Title: “changed my mind on 2 star hotels!”
Reviews.Author: littlemiss1994
Reviews.Content: had a great stay! staff were very helpful the rooms were modern and very clean fairly small rooms but who needs a big room in paris! very central, we got the ferry to calais which was an absolut bargain at 20 pounds return each but beware the train from calais to paris is expensive! the metro station of which this ibis hotel is at is on the same line as the main train station in paris.the hotel is a 2 minute walk from the moulin rouge which i highly recommend and allother attractions are easily accessible would highly reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: rob-annie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Ibis for 3 nights while travelling around Paris. We found the room to be very nice, somewhat small but it didn't bother us as we didn't live there. The bed was comfy and the shower was very good, which were the main things. Also had free wi-fi, which was brilliant. The breakfast was simple but plentiful and served the purpose but was a bit expensive for what it was. The best thing about it was the location - so close to the metro, Moulin Rouge, Sacre Coeur, which made touring much quicker and simpler, lovely boulangeries and restaurants nearby. Parking was very expensive next door, but what else can you expect in the middle of Paris. Would recommend this for people wishing to travel around and not looking for anything too special.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, efficient, comfortable and a good area.”
Reviews.Author: passinginterest
Reviews.Content: Having looked through vast numbers of hotels and almost spent more than double the amount on a 4 star place in La Defense we were delighted we picked the Ibis. We were wary of booking an independent hotel due to the vastly different reviews on trip advisor and having stayed in an Ibis previously in Cork we had a good idea what to expect. I travelled with my girlfriend and another couple and we had rooms on the 7th floor with a lovely view over Montmartre cemetary and up to the Sacre Coeur, the room was small but had all necesseties, an extremely comfortable bed and a lovely powerful shower/bath, the cleanliness was perfect and the staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English (which came in handy given my rusty and pretty poor French!). The buffet breakfast is good value at 7.50 with cereal, bread, meat, cheese, pancakes, cake, croissants, pain au chocolat, fresh fruit and hot and cold drinks available, all of which were fresh and delicious. The Place de Clichy metro station is on the doorstep, the Moulin Rouge is around the corner and Sacre Coeur is walking distance (although be aware it's all uphill and it's steep, we did it the first day and had sore feet for most of the weekend afterwards). I'd definitely advise making use of the metro, just 1.60 will get you just about anywhere from Place de Clichy with a direct line to the Arc de Triumph and connections very easy to all the main areas. Overall we had a great stay, we could have spent an awful lot more and I doubt we would have had a much better hotel experience, all we really look for in a hotel is nice staff, good bed, good shower and very clean and all those requirements were easily met.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms but very clean”
Reviews.Author: PortugalTravelerP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ibis Montmartre for 4 nights. The hotel is very well located, near the Moulin rouge and walking distance to the Sacré Coeur. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are small but very clean which is not that easy to find is Paris for this price. Breakfast is quite complete – try the croissants! It’s a regular Ibis hotel, so you know what to expect, no surprises and a good service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and a great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: chivasd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights recently and we were very happy with the experience. Granted the rooms are basic but if you are out all day sightseeing you don't need anything fancy. The hotel is spotlessly clean, bed was very comfy and the shower was great, very powerful and hot. We even had a view of Sacre Coeur from our window! The only disadvantage to the room was that we were only given 2 bath towels and no hand towels. Maybe if we had asked for extra they would have been given but we didn't bother. The breakfast buffet was great, plenty of pastries, crepes, fruit, yoghurt, cereal, coffee, teas, hot chocolate and some cold meats. And the staff were so nice also. The best thing about this hotel is the location; literally a 3 min walk from Place de Clichy Metro and within walking distance of Montmarte and Sacre Coeur. There are plenty of eateries and bars on the street as well. Although the hotel is near the Red Light District it is by no means within it, so it might be a better choice for young families who want to stay in the general area. All in all a great experience and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “NIce but small”
Reviews.Author: blackswanMalaysia
Reviews.Content: Located very near to Moulin Rouge. Nice room but small, we can't even fit our bags in the wardrobe. Breakfast is very nice with croissant, pastries, cakes, cereal, fruits, ham and cheese. The best croissant ever. We travelled by metro so is very convenient to reach all the attractions. The area is filled with restaurants and is closed to Sacre Coeur. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Euroboyeric
Reviews.Content: Great location, amore modern room than other Ibis, helpfull staff. Great for business or leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location....Average accommodation”
Reviews.Author: rangerfan23
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one-night stay at the Ibis due to our being in town for a particular event. From London, we took an early Eurostar train and arrived in Paris at 11am. The walk from the Gard de Nord was easy and took less than 30 minutes. Check-in was not supposed to be until noon, but they allowed us to access our room early, which was nice. The hotel is very near the Metro station and in a quick stroll to Moulin Rouge. The room was in the back of the hotel, overlooking the cemetery and if you stuck your head out of the window just a little further, you could see the Sacre Coeur! As far as the rest of the room, it was just what you would expect from Ibis. It was small, empty, however as we only needed a clean room with a bed and shower for a night, it proved to be adequate. There is a restaurant and bar (although we didn't go) and breakfast in the morning for a reasonable price. All in all, the Ibis was a good choice for what we needed and would recommend it for anyone that was in Paris for a brief stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough!”
Reviews.Author: nando2
Reviews.Content: In cities like Paris,we usually choose Ibis hotels,because they are functional, comfortable and at a nice price, though they have become more expensive and increasingly expensive over the past few years. As a frequent traveller to Paris I used to stay at this hotel until 2005, then chose other Ibis around town, and came back to it this year, and it was a good surprise to realize the hotel had been renovated in the meantime. It's Ibis so you get: a nice and full breakfast, a cozy but rather small room, and generally a rather kind and helpful staff. But it started on the wrong foot: we were given a backyard room in some sort of catacombs situated somewhere between the ground floor and the second floor. The room looked older and less comfortable, with different fixtures from the rest of the hotel, as we already knew beforehand. So we were forced to ask for a change, and we were given a much better room on the 5th floor, with renovated fixtures and a much happier look. Apart from that the staff was helpful and kind, the internet was free and worked properly, and the hotel is situated right next to the Place de Clichy and the rue caulaincourt, two starting points for a trip around Paris: Montmartre is nearby and so is Pigalle, the Moulin Rouge, and by underground, all the centre of beautiful Paris. Apart from the first impressions, our stay was quite pleasant and tranquil. One negative aspect is that, because of business travellers and tourist groups, some times the reception desk is flooded with people which allows for a 15 minute or more wait before you're tended to.But that is not exactly Ibis' fault.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - would recommend without any hesitation”
Reviews.Author: Chiggster
