Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3-nights in September. It was my second trip to Paris but my friends' first time and they also thoroughly recommend the hotel. There are some nice bars and restaurants nearby and Place de Clichy Metro stop is very close to the hotel. Pigalle Metro is also nearby but, be warned, it's a little seedier area than Montmartre (sex shops etc!) so don't go there with children or those of a nervous disposition (my friend was offered a lap-dance at 2 o'clock in the afternoon!) The rooms are basic but clean, the shower was excellent and the bed comfortable. Having read previous reviews we requested rooms at the back and on higher floors overlooking the cemetary but didn't discover until the last morning that (had we leaned out a little further out of the window) we had a lovely view of Sacre Coeur! The staff were all very pleasant and extremely helpful especially on the last morning when our pre-booked transfer failed to turn up, the receptionist called them on on our behalf and gave them a right telling off (even though my french is fairly basic, I reckon they got the message!). She then called a Parisienne taxi firm who arrive within 10 minutes! Breakfast is available for a very reasonable price of 7.5Euros (coffee, juice, croissant, cereals, fruit, cheese, ham & breads) - there were cheaper breakfasts available at local cafes but I don't think they had the same selection (just juice, coffee & croissants mainly). With regards the transfers to and from the airport; it's a mixed report I'm afraid. We'd booked online with Inter-shuttle in the UK for CDG pickup and, although the driver was a little late, it was a relatively smooth experience. Not so on the return! As one of our party had difficulty walking, we decided to use the same company to drop us back to CDG so, 24-hrs before our departure time the Receptionist phoned them on our behalf and arranged a 12.30pm pick-up but they didn't show. The cost of the shuttle transfer was 65Euros but the taxi fare was only 42Euros so, next time, I reckon I'd take a taxi or use the Metro/Bus system as it's fairly easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good, basic, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ciderman64
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Ibis recently, as you would expect the hotel was clean, with a good level of service, Our room on the 4th floor was quite small (again, as you would expect for the price) and we were given the choice of road or cemetery views (cemetery view was very peaceful naturally), Free WiFi was realy useful, obtained through passwords obtained at reception. Didn't eat there but frequented the bar on the 1st floor which was a pretty soulless affair but did claim to be open 24 hours, But without doubt, the main reason for booking this Ibis is the location - near to bars and restaurants on rue Lepic, Abbess and Caulaincourt, Place de Clichy metro is 2 minutes walk away and buses pass outside the hotel. Great location, decent cheap hotel, well worth booking for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ozboyz
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed three nights at this hotel and what a life saver it turned out to be. Our origional hotel we had booked was such a dump that we had to walk out and in desperation asked the taxi driver to take us to the nearest Ibis as we had not idea on what other hotel options we had. I had to google for the address as taxi driver had no idea and this hotel in Montmatre was the first to pop up, so we said there. The room although basic was clean and comfortable. Our room looked out over the cemetry and was relatively quiet - there is a school there also and an underground car park so you could hear the sounds when the window was open. The staff here were extremely friendly. They spoke English and were able to help out will all our questions. The hotel is located a 10 or 15 minute walk from the Sacre Coeur. And about 5 minutes from Moulin Rouge. There is a metro at Place Clichy which allows you to get around the entire area of Paris. Downside to hotel - no iron in room. You have to go to a room downstairs and iron there. Only one iron but a bit of a hassle. Get a day ticket for the metro - only just under 6 euros. Downside to Paris. Very expensive. As a travelling Aussie we found the food and drink to be over priced. 7 Euro for a beer works out to be about 12 or 13 dollars and since we normally only pay 5 then this was a shock. Food too very expensive. We paid nearly $40 for two big mac meals. Restaraunts charged anything from 10 to 20 euros for starters, then more for a main and similar for desert, so be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amyriam3
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel in Paris, near Sacre Coeur and Moulin Rouge (5 min). Nearest metrostation at about 2-5 min, Place de Clichy... Very easy when coming from Gare du Nord (Thalys) to take the metro there (line 2). I loved the clean room and nice bathroom with warm water. We had a quiet room. The breakfast was very nice! Many choices with different breads and small pancakes, ... Reception was very friendly and helpfull when needing information. We could leave our 3 medium luggages in the storage room for only EUR 3. They were doing some renovations, but I didn't noticed. Defenitely I would recommend this hotel for leisure in Paris. When going back to Paris, I'll take this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to see Paris”
Reviews.Author: Slm365w
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night to break up our journey back from Brittany. The location is excellent, a 5 minute walk from the metro station Place de Clichy from where you can easily reach Gare Montparnasse or Gare du Nord. Also close to Sacre Coeur, Moulin Rouge and lots of bistros. As for the hotel itself, it was very quiet, the room was clean and modern, with a great shower and a comfortable bed - ideal if you just want somewhere to crash for the night. We booked quite early and managed to get the room for just under 60 Euros. It looks like they are renovating the 5th floor at the moment as we accidentally went to this floor first before going to our room on the 3rd floor. However we could not hear any building work going on and so was not an issue. It is a basic room so you do not get a kettle to make hot drinks, though there is a vending machine in reception for cans, snacks etc. We didn't eat any food in the hotel so wecan't comment on the quality of the breakfast or other meals.We would definitely stay here again and would have no problems staying for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all respects”
Reviews.Author: GallopingLawyer
Reviews.Content: Great location - 5 minutes from metro station. Plenty of bars and restaurants in the locality. Perfectly placed for attractions such as Sacre Coeur, Moulin Rouge etc. Modern hotel. Our room was spotlessly clean and extremely quiet. Even with the window open, we had no noise. The bed was very comfortable. As the room was small, the bed was pushed against a wall. We didn't particularly like that. Not masses of room for luggage or clothes, but we were only there for 2 nights so it was fine. We could have done with a couple more pillows and towels, but I'm sure we would have got them if we'd have asked. Check in and out was very easy. I speak reasonable French. I'm sure the staff speak English if necessary. We didn't eat in the hotel, but had a few drinks in the bar. Surprisingly, it was cheaper to drink here than outside the hotel. The communal areas are air conditioned. We really appreciated the baggage store - lockers are provided at E3 or E5 - absolutely great. Hotel didn't mind us using the facilities after we'd checked out. We paid E85 each night. I thought that was great value for the location and facilities. I'd definitely stay here again. Its not as flash as some Paris hotels, but we tend to be out and about a lot and I'd rather spend the cash in a restaurant than on facilities I'm not going to use!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JeanneBucharest75
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful vacation in Paris and Ibis Montmartre helped us by its great location! Rooms were pretty small, but very comfortable and very, very clean, which was very important for us, taking into consideration that we have been there with our children of 6 years old. The staff was extremely polite and helpful! They helped us to make reservations at Moulin Rouge and they answered to all our questions about the directions and places to visit! The subway Place de Clichy is 2 minutes walk from the hotel and with a card Paris Visite for 5 days you can go anywhere in and out of Paris (Versaille, Disneyland etc). We would recommend Ibis Montmartre Hotel to everyone who likes to enjoy a perfect holiday, no matter what age are they! We'll stay at Ibis Montmartre again for our next holiday in Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: MUSKY9
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights and drove over from the UK. Room was small but very clean and what a power shower to blast away the grime of the day. We wanted to be central and this location was perfect with our 11 year old daughter. The breakfast was good and the staff helpful. If you want internet there is a cyber cafe next door with cheap net access. Parked in the secure underground place next door and found the the local food ok. Even at 11.50pm we got good food just down the road. Don't blow your money on the hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The city of love!”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Heaven
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day trip to Paris, having stayed in other Ibis hotels i decided that its usually a safe bet, nothing flashy but you get what you pay for. The Ibis Montmartre exceeded my expectations. The hotels location is excellent, place de clichy metro stop is a stones throw from hotel. Area is lively as well which added to it, moulin rouge etc within easy walking distance. First impressions from outside are excellent as hotel looks very modern, inside is much like any other ibis. Small seating area, nice reception etc. The gentleman that checked us in was very nice and told us to call down if we had any questions. He also asked what side we wanted to stay on, i decided that the cemetary side would be nice as i had read some reviews here about the view. He then mentioned that he had one larger room left for us on the 8th floor, i suspected that this was his customary thing to say...however our room was at the end of the corridor and was certainly big enough, looking at the floor layout attached to door infact showed our room to be substantially bigger than the others(so if your staying ask for room 800). The room itself was comfortable, the bed was very nice after a long day of sight seeing. Bathroom was spotlessly clean. We had breakfast on two of the mornings at 8euro per person. It wasn't busy and the selection was quite good, only thing was that breakfast ran from 6am until 12noon, as we had breakfast around 10am on both days the bread felt like it had maybe been out since 6am. Nice selection of juices, cereals, tea, coffee, fresh fruit, croissants etc. Its conveniant more than anything else. All in all an excellent hotel, you don't go to Paris to spend the day in the hotel so i think it serves its purpose quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly French”
Reviews.Author: GILLBRUSSELS
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6 originally booked at another Ibis in Central Paris (so confirm and double confirm your bookings, as when we got there we were told they had no booking for us. What a blow, it was cold and snowing and now we had to find another hotel as they just shrugged their shoulders in denial. They recommended Ibis La Defense; arrived there only to discover it was so far away from all amendities sightseeing venues and restuarants and it was very cramped. We were advised by the only nice cabdriver we have ever met in Paris, to move to Montmarte. Yes it was very central, The price however was more than La Defense (from Euros59 to Euros102. The staff at Montmarte was not very friendly, but I believe that this seems to be the norm, with all French people. Unfriendly and miserable but then considering the gloomy looks of paris, can you blame them. The rooms were very small and breakfast so standard and tasteless. Food at all Ibis hotels in Paris really leaves one wanting...... Wanting real food and they are so skimpy on food... You can either a vegetable or rice. They should visit South Africa and USA, Fantastic Spain, Brussels and even Amsterdam to experience real cuisine where we are not afraid to dish a sincerely heartwarming meal with a variety of vegetables to choose from at a darn good price. We arrived at Montmarte Ibis and were not even informed of renovations that has begun at this hotel, only to be rudely awaken every morning to drilling and knocking down of walls, without offering a discount because of the noise and inconvenience. They even had the audacity to tell us to move rooms, without any notice. We had scramble our goods together and do so within as quickly as possible, we were told, as the builders were moving to our floor. How disrespectfull and this after were have been staying here for more than 2 weeks, only because it was fairly central. We just had enough of the incompetent staff and arrogant attitudes even the housekeeping staff at ibis, just opens the doors as they please without respect. (I must add that Ibis in Brussels breakfast are way more superior and staff more friendly). We then moved to Ibis Porte de Clichy. its not that central but if you look around you will find some nice eating places in the main road and even a nice Supermarket, that will really save you some Euros if you buy your drinks there instead of spending 2 Euros on a can of cola at the hotel you can purchase a 2 litre Coke for 2Euros. They even have a indoor heated swimming pool and sauna and at least a variety of restuarants, although the food is very very plain and standard. I have been honest enjoy and be carefull of Ibis. What happened to the customer is very important. IT SEEMS THEIR MOTO IS 'OUR WAY OR THE HIGH WAY'. Very dissapointing attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “Great base, small rooms but who cares?”
Reviews.Author: amyjane1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights over New Year 2008. Found that all hotels in Montmartre during this period were a) expensive and b) booked up. At 90 euros a night it is fairly reasonable compared to others in the area (although with the exchange rate at 1:1 euro/pound, it's still quite pricy! Hotel is in a good location. Situated neatly between Pigalle and Montmartre. It's a 3 minute walk to Place de Clichy metro stop which is about 3 / 4 stops from the Champs Elysees. Takes about 15/20 minutes walking to get to the Sacre Coeur. Tons of nice restaurants around. So can't complain about the location at all! Didn't bother with breakfast - 8 euros seemed quite steep and there were a couple of nice bakers around where you can get a pain au chocolate for 1.50. Rooms were clean - water was hot and I enjoyed the shower pressure! My room on 6th floor was absolutely tiny. But, even though we were there for 5 nights I don't really mind a small room as you spend most of the day out anyway! Staff were friendly enough - my only interaction was briefly at the beginning and end, so no problems there. Sadly I had no view except overlooking other hotel rooms. Sounds like the views over Sacre Coeur are worth a look! Would recommend it as simple and basic, but overall very adequate!

Reviews.Title: “Small room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: fcsantos
Reviews.Content: The bad: The room was very small, with a tiny closet and the window face to the back of the hotel, so we din't have a nice view. The hotel look more like an hospital. The good: Great location, near the metro, the bed was very comfortable and the room very clean. With security cams on all floors. For the price, it's an okay hotel to spend a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: auvenj
Reviews.Content: The room was small and basic but functional and clean. The staff spoke English and was helpful. Security was good - you use your room card to get up to the floor where the rooms are. Location was great - walking to lots of restaurants, shops, and Sacre-Cour, and very close to a metro station for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tirrelli03
Reviews.Content: This was a nice budget hotel. I certainly wouldn’t have paid the rack rate of 85 Euros per night, but for 59 Euros per night (booked through the website) this was a deal. The room we first checked in to smelled a little bit of pets and cigarette smoke (they pet-friendly, but smoke-free, so someone must have broken the rules and smoked in the room.) We told the staff and they quickly moved us to a different room which was much better. The rooms were small, but fine for two nights. We ended up getting breakfast too, which was well worth it! They serve hot crepes with a wide assortment of breads and rolls along with plenty of types of jam, butter and Nutella. They also served pastries, fruit, cheese, cereal, several types of fruit juices and had a coffee machine (not the best, but not terrible.)

Reviews.Title: “Good location - shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: sj1977
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in numerous Ibis hotels all over France and normally recommend them - OK, they are all the same but you know what you're getting and I would rather pay their price (75Euros per night) and get something clean and comfortable than some grotty backstreet hotel that resembles a 1970s brothel (as most of the hotels I checked out in Montmartre did). I can't complain about the cleanliness of the room and bathroom, the piping hot water, the general hotel or the fantastic location (just a few minutes walk and you're in the heart of Old Montmartre). HOWEVER, when I book a room with two beds, I expect to get the room I booked. I've had this problem at another Ibis hotel - they don't seem to acknowledge that two guests staying in the same room don't always want to sleep together..... We got to our room and lo and behold, it was a double. I went back to reception and was told to go back and look under the sheets as it may have been two singles pushed together (WHY didn't they know this anyway?). I duly returned and found that it was a double. I then had an argument with the receptionist stating I had specifically booked a room which had a single AND a double bed on the Accor website (they had no twin rooms left). It soon emerged they had let a family have that room and it was 'impossible' to let two people have a room that sleeps three! Pathetic - I have stayed on my own in triple rooms before. Surely you pay for the room not the number of guests anyway these days. And it was a HUGE hotel - they can't have been full. Anyway, they begrudgingly got the maid to bring in a single bed and we were crammed into a tiny room for two nights. This just about rounded off a holiday in which I was mugged on the Metro, experienced rude waiters, a lack of vegetarian food and the Eurostar was delayed on the way back. I usually love Paris and have been many times on my own - but will not be going back in a hurry. So my general advice: if booking an Ibis room with a friend, either make sure you are VERY close or just don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “great positioning, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilinca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week. It started really bad as the staff at the reception couldn't figure out the 2 rooms we had booked well in advance, which made us stay and wait for more then half an hour. Nobody spoke decent english, they just knew the basics so we couldn;t make them understand what we were saying. Thank god my mom speaks french a bit so we managed in the end (by the way they haev this policy that if you have a problem that doesn't get solved in 15 minutes they pay your rom for the night.. yeah that didn;t happen to us after we waited for much longer than 15 minutes). In fact during our stay there were always people at the front desk as appaently the staff couldn't manage to solve issues quickly. Our rooms were big and very comfortable and clean. Not so lucky were some of our friends staying in the 3rd floor (we were at 7) who had extremely tiny rooms: if they would put their suitcase next to the bed there was no space left to move. I should also mention that all rooms are double and there is no possibility of extra bed for kids over 9 or 10 years, as the 3rd bed is apparently really small. The area is great, right the the foot of Montmartre area (which is abolsutlely great, especially at night on the steps of Sacre coeur) and next to Place Pigalle (the "red" district). However it is very safe as it is always crowded and we neved had the feeling of uncertainty even when we came back after 1 am. My feeling is that if you are lucky enough to find good staff and get a big room this hotel can be quite a pleasant stay (due also to the fact that it has decent prices compared to other hotels in this area)
